Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a city break in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: aprilbirrell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment at the Adina Hotel at the end of March 2012. It was spotlessly clean and in a really good location. The rooms were a modern, and good size with a kettle, toaster etc in the kitchen area. The towels were changed every day and the staff were very helpful with directions etc. They let us store our luggage at the end of our stay and we picked it up on the way back to the train station. The beds were clean and comfortable. There is a pool which again was very clean and a gym. We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on that. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Hauptbahnhof rail station. The rail station has a fantastic underground link which goes straight to the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag and only takes about 5 minutes. You can also walk from the hotel to the centre of Berlin which only takes about 20 minutes. Most things are within walking distance, but if not, the Hauptbahnhof station will take you anywhere. It was slightly tricky at times to know which line to take but there is an information desk and the vendors who work at the food outlets were knowledgeable and pointed us in the right direction more than once. There is a supermarket about 5 minutes from the hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great landing pad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janniebeth
Reviews.Content: For our first-ever visit to Berlin in late March, Dear Hubby and I chose Adina HBF as our ‘landing pad’ hotel. (It is a 10 minute walk from the station.) Displeased to find ubiquitous construction around the station and its neighborhood, we were all-the-more delighted to find Adina and its street a serene oasis. Our suite was on the sixth floor overlooking a courtyard where guests could sit out. Décor was tasteful and modern. There was a living area with couch, armchair & tv; a bedroom with split-mattress double bed, ample closet space and drawers and another tv; a little dining area, desk area, and a kitchen with fridge, dishwasher, two-burner stove and a combination convection oven-microwave. Unhappily, there was no proper coffee maker, even upon request, though there was an electric kettle. The bathroom was large and clean, with combo tub/shower and lots of counter space and makeup mirror. We were there for four days. Cost averaged out to about 90 euros per day, which we considered a really good deal for what we got. Wifi and breakfast are extra. And the best wifi deal is the option that charges only for time spent online BUT be sure to log out each time. There were a couple glitches during out stay, though we do not fault the hotel (unless other travelers report the same experiences): On the two weekdays we were there, window washer crews showed up before 8 and began a clacking round of work at office buildings across the courtyard. And, on our last evening, part of the electricity blew out for that evening, though nothing we needed crucially. But if it had been a hot day, we would have been without ac. But do note: The young woman who came to help us tried several times to fix it, and a technician showed up bright and early the next morning. The construction around the bahnhof was a real ‘downer’, though we found that all over Berlin. But we loved the futuristic bahnhof building itself, and went there for our food and other supplies and just to gape. And this Adina we do highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Josephine H
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment for almost two weeks and had such a fond memory of the place. It provided a homelike feeling but five star service apartment at a reasonable cost. Although its a bit far from city centre, the friendly transportation system in Berlin makes you hassle free no matter how far you are from city. Of course, the staff from Adina are very helpful and resourceful in giving us travelling tips. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, ideal for city break”
Reviews.Author: LindaS328
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this hotel enough. Great location - walking distance from station and main Berlin sights. Room facilities brilliant. We had a studio room for three of us which was a good size and included an extremely useful kitchenette and seating area. The room was spotless, had a great shower and very comfortable beds. Buffet breakfast was superb - lots of choice: hot/cold choice, pastries, breads - too much to mention. Pool and sauna extremely welcome after a long day's touring and finally the staff were wonderful - nothing was too much trouble. A very impressive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great acomodation, but far from touristic sights”
Reviews.Author: RafaelGrottoli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, the room is new and with nice space, including small kitchen (micro-oven, sink and small refrigerator). The bed is amazing. Good breakfeast also. The only problem for me was that the hotel is a little far from the main sights, you need to walk 3-4 blocks for the subway or for a touristic bus. Internet is paid but has great quality.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel apartment, good location, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Andozer
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant apartment hotel. My other half and I stayed for 2 nights and were upgraded to a 1-bed apartment upon check-in. The apartment was a good size, very clean and modern, well equipped kitchenette, etc. The only reason I gave this a 4 for comfort was because the air con didn't seem to work and it was quite hot, but there was a simple solution - open the window! Otherwise this was perfect. Staff were really helpful and friendly, restaurant was good, very pleasant stay - and very reasonable price! The hotel is located about 5-10 mins walk from Hauptbahnhof station, and then another 5 mins or so to the heart of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Adina”
Reviews.Author: LandD2009
Reviews.Content: We returned from Berlin last night and felt I had to write a review. We went for 3 nights B&B with easyjet as a city break for me and my partner. We stayed in a studio apartment which was fantastic - it was very spacious and modern with a good sized bathroom, a separate sitting and kitchen area and a bedroom area separated by a small partition. We also had a balcony with a table and chairs and view of the TV Tower and Berlin Dome Cathedral. The room had everything you could need. The breakfast was fantastic and much better than I have experienced in other city hotels around Europe. We travelled to the hotel by train from the airport to the Hauptbahnhof and then a ten minute walk to the hotel, and the same on the way back. We also made use of the Berlin Welcome Card sold by the hotel to use the trains in the city from either the Hauptbahnhof or Friedrichstrasse, when our feet got tired. This card also gives 25% discount at many tourist attractions. I'd recommend the Adina to singles, couples, families and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel, Super Facilities, Great Location, Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: taff37
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th visit to Berlin & we chose the Adina Hauptbanhof after TA research, The 2011 TA Winners Plaque on the outside wall was well deserved. We booked our flight plus room, for 3 nights, via Easyjet Holidays - and we were delighted with the location of the hotel, the facilities in the room, the friendliness & professionalism of staff plus an extensive, delightful buffet breakfast. The room was large, spotlessly clean, with a contemporary en suite and comfortable bed. Our view from the window was an inner courtyard - but other rooms had external views. The Hotel has a nice swimming pool - a very decent gym, with sturdy equipment - and a sauna. We never used the restaurant - but the food/prices looked good. We did have 'end of evening' night caps sat in the comfy leather armchairs in the classy bar area. We missed the daily 'Happy Hour' from 5 to 7 each evening when prices were very keen. The Adina Hauptbanhof is a 10 minute stroll to Freidrichstrasse - Berlin's equivalent to (say) Oxford St, London. From Friedrichstrasse you can walk to most of the major sites in Berlin. Also off this street are loads of restaurants, bars, cafes, fast food outlets & shops to suit all pockets. As we were in Berlin to spend time with friends, and have done most of the Berlin tourist sites - we visited the nearby Natural History museum, 200 yds from the Adina, containing a great Dinosaur exhibition and huge Hairy Mammoth. On our last day in Berlin we ate Lunch, next to the river, in the sunshine at Koepenick Castle in the East of the City. The Adina is suitable for couples, business travellers or families. Its lounge area, pool, gym, bar & restaurant compare to a good 4* Hotel. The washing machine, cooker, fridge, tea/coffee making facilities, etc. allow those on a budget to obtain even further value for money. As a big fan of The Circus Hotel (TA's #1 Berlin Hotel) I did not expect the Adina to be as good. Both Hotels - are contemporary, spotlessly clean, welcoming, non 'stuffy' and offer excellent value for their location. On my next visit to Berlin I will happily stay at either. Danke to all the Adina Hauptbanhof.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: LittleMoRollyPollies
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, close to the main train station but not too close so no noise problems, fantastic room and hotel amenities. Very helpful staff. Decor perfect and immaculately clean. Pool and spa available. Breakfast buffet 20 euros...a huge selection. Much better value than the breakfasts to be found in the local restaurants/cafes. For the price you will not find better. The majority of reviews are accurate. Faultless accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Yay! An apartment, and laundry!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy V
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and the bonus for me was the laundry facilities! Very handy when you are on a long holiday! The apartment was great and spacious with everything you could want in a kitchen if you felt the need to cook for yourself. The service was spot on and the bar was a lovely place in the evening to chat to fellow travelers! Everywhere was easily walkable from here and we wished we could stay longer. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comforts”
Reviews.Author: Marica P
Reviews.Content: Having travelled from Australia we loved all the Australian photos. We also loved the Australian 'Rolling Hills' wines. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment, one bedroom with an ensuite and the other with access to a great sized bathroom/laundry. There was a great kitchenette. We ordered room service on our first night's stay and found it to be very good. The Aussie burger was great. The hotel is about a ten minute walk to 'Hauptbahnhof' or a quick cab ride (approx 8-10 euros). The service was friendly and polite. We found this hotel to be great value for money, very clean and modern. We greatly enjoyed our stay and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartments.”
Reviews.Author: Aus_PM_73
Reviews.Content: I will start with my only (small gripe) about this hotel. It's a bit too far from Berlin's Hauptbahnof to use the name. It's not a really long walk to the train station but it is if you have all your bags. Yes, I know, it's easy to find places on maps through internet these days but when a place carries the name "Hauptbahnhof" you could expect that it's barely a stone's throw away. Nevertheless, everything else is fantastic. The staff are friendly and helpful and the apartments are magnificent. How wonderful it is to have the luxury of a lounge room and a large bathroom with a great front loading washing machine and a dryer at a normal hotel room price! I would definitely stay again and I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: Scarlet-Poppy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant value considering you get a bedroom, living area and kitchen and it's spacious too. And if you don't want to bother making your own breakfast you still have the bonus of a restaurant downstairs to do it for you! The bar is really cosy in the evenings with leather chairs to lounge in and a happy hour from 5-7 to coax you in. Cocktails were delicious! There are more central locations to stay, but this is about 5-10 mins walk from the main station where you can get the U & S bahn trains all over Berlin. There is a supermarket 5 mins away if you do want to do a bit of self catering - which is possible in the fully fitted kitchen. Got a lovely bottle of Shiraz for €2. How is that even possible?? There are also a few little restaurants nearby if you don't want to venture out too far. Nice little pool and sauna to chil out after a day walking round. And reasonable priced wifi if you want it. All in all this place was great and brilliant value.

Reviews.Title: “Almost excellent (again)”
Reviews.Author: dinstereo
Reviews.Content: Though the room this time was smaller (but still bigger than most hotel rooms at this price), it had a city view which made it even better as I could see the Fernsehturm, the Hauptbahnhof and other places from there. Of course the room was very clean, with more than the usual amenities. The pool and the gym were also clean and nice, and the stuff are so helpful you feel obliged. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Aparthotel”
Reviews.Author: blairelliot
Reviews.Content: really good apartments, very handy are the rooms where you can fit 2 double beds in either side of the apartment clean, good tv selection, good location, good value

Reviews.Title: “Really, really nice!”
Reviews.Author: ellegaard
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 mature couples stayed at the Adina for 3 nights in Feb 2012. The hotel is without fault - rooms spacious and spotless. Close to main station and handy for the U-train. We bought Berlin Welcome travel cards in the hotel - good value and so convenient. The breakfast was absolutely delicious and comprehensive with omelettes made to order. They even had a special Valentines Day cake for Feb 14. breakfast. served to my wife by Ajsam the incredibly hard-working waiter. Staff very helpful, kind and pleasant - excellent English. Stay there - you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and fantastically designed apartment”
Reviews.Author: Ross_Belinda_Aust
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio apartment for 7 nights. The room was spacious and well designed - with the bedroom section being hidden behind a central wall. The room was well equipped with a convection oven, fridge with mini freezer, dishwasher, plates and cooking utensils, bath and hairdryer. Wifi was pay per use but not too expensive and of a decent speed. You did need to jump on, jump off which was a little annoying but did the job. There were two large TVs with the extra one mounted on the bedroom wall. The location was good being within walking distance to town and the main train station. Some taxi drivers had trouble finding the street so it's a good idea to know other streets near the apartments. The staff were lovely and helpful, checking in and out was a breeze. We would stay at these apartments again and also recommend them to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great experinece, and we got upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Visko13
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Adina only for 3 nights but the experience was great. our room was upgraded to a larger room, the kitchen and bathroom was large and clean. the living space had couch and table sets. plenty of room for two for us, made us feel at home the moment we stepped in the room. washing machine and dryer in the bathroom however you have to purchase a washing detergent from reception which is only 0.95 Euro or bring your own. Staff spoke clear English and very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a little expensive we thought however the food was good. Gym was good with basic equipments and the large pool and sauna looked great. if we knew about this earlier, we could have brought swimmers with us! hotel was located close to subway stations and was easy to go around. We would definitely stay here again! Thank you Adina Hauptbahnhof!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: christineGlasgow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from main train station and very easy to find. On arrival staff were great and their English was fantastic. Our room was a great size, very big, with a kitchenette, dining table, sofa, desk and chair and a very large bed. There was also a large balcony with a table and chairs. The bathroom was lovely, large, modern and very clean. We booked the cheapest room available so were very pleased with the standard of our room. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to Brandenberg Gate down a straight street right outside the hotel, so we walked everywhere. Was a 20-25 minute walk to Alexander Platz where the TV tower is. The U Bahn and S Bahn train system is very easy to navigate and you can get everywhere from the train station 5 minutes walk away. Overall we had a great stay and I would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value luxury and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: JasonMarni
Reviews.Content: A short walk from train station and easy to get to the city centre. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean and felt like 5 star compared to the many ibis's we had stayed in before hand. It was very quiet and the restaurant was nice. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Leonie29
Reviews.Content: The apartments are in a fantastic location, very close to berlins main train station which means you can get anywhere very easily. There is a nice Italian restaurant close by, go early though as they run out quickly. The hotel restaurant was very quiet when we visited and a little over priced. Swimming pool and facilities were brilliant. Only 1 small problem, there was no hair dryer in the room? Overall a really good place to stay. We will stay there again when we go this year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, hotel, location and overall excellence”
Reviews.Author: Sonny206
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 25th January 2012 to Friday 27th January 2012 and it was a pleasant experence. The hotel is so close to the Train Station (Berlin Hauptbahnhof) which has restaurants, shops and a tourist centre for all the questions you need answering. When we arrived, check in was simple and they had already taken note of my request of a lower floor and twin room having emailed the hotel prior to arriving. Also, my mum does not use the lifts so they accomodated our request and ensured we could use the stairs freely, although not all staff were aware of this and a few times the door to the stairs would get locked but they sorted this once informed. The room itself was immaculate. It was so clean, and I have nothing to fault. The beds were comfy, and luxury bedding. The bathroom was clean and shower was so hot and powerful (perfect after a cold day out!). The apartment had a hairdryer, iron. My apartment room also had full kitchen facilities, and a microwave which was handy. A fridge was also good. The variety was fab for breakfast, including cereal, sausages, bacon, eggs, pastries, cold meats, cheese, yoghurts and much more. We happen to be there when the hotel celebrated australia day, and luckily had australian champagne complimentary at breakfast, and desserts such as mud pie and pavlova. The pool area and sauna looked lovely although we didnt get a chance to use them. They also provide a complimentary internet service, with a fast speed connection to a computer near reception to use at your leisure which was really good. Staff were friendly and accomodating. The restaurant aldo had nice food and the bar drinks were good too, we had a cocktail at happy hour and well worth it. I would definately recommend this hotel for your stay in Berlin, and I can fully appreciate why they are ranked 9th best in Berlin, Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gerri k
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double room in the fifth floor, the room was large, beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The staff was very kind, always willing to help, especially in the restaurant area. Breakfast is delicious and we had a lovely meal at night where I ate linguini with king prawns that were absolutely wonderful. I fully recommend this hotel, it is close to the main train station and a 10 minute walking distance to main sights in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous apartrment with great view of the city”
Reviews.Author: kakiayam
Reviews.Content: Had a small apartment in front of the lift. Initially I thought it might busy with people traffic but it wasn't. The apartment was on the top floor with a balcony that you can sit out for two. It has a fabulous view towards the city. The apartment was nicely designed and compacted. Slept very well in that great double bed. The bedroom section has a huge sliding wardrobe with security box. It has also a small flat screen tv. The lounge area has a long sofa to lounge in with a huge flat screen tv. The small kitchen area has a small cooking station with limited cooking pots for cooking. It didn't really bother us. We just use them for breakfast and take takeaway home and eat them at the small dinning table for two. Theres even a working desk which is huge. The bathroom was huge with nice toiletries. There was a shower with no bath. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We hired bikes from them which were new and great fun and easy to use. One morning, We used the small swimming pool which is about 14m in length. I think it's good for two swimming the length of the pool. More than that, it would feel crowded. There were many loungers around the pool. 10mins walk to the Berlin gate and a bit more to the main train station. About 15-20mins to other areas with eating places. We had a good deal on the apartment via ebookers. Would love to return to stay if we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rob99Wales
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a 10 minute walk from the main train station, where you can get the train to the airport (35 mins) and the S-Bahn and U-Bahn for getting around the city. It's then a 20 minute walk to the Reichstag and Brandenburg Gate, so a fairly central location overall. Rooms are nice - decent kitchen with fridge, dishwasher, hob, microwave etc. We all found our rooms a little hot (despite it being January and only just above freezing outside!), so slept with the window open as the aircon wasn't powerful enough to cool the place. This just meant a little traffic noise from around 7am, but the road outside isn't too busy, so this wasn't much of an issue. Friendly staff who were happy to book restaurants for us. Overall, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: tessa02
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 3 nights in November . What a great hotel . The rooms are large and very well equipped . They are also very clean . The staff are extremely friendly and very helpful . Location is great .. just a short walk to the local station. I would highly recommend this hotel . We would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Faultless Hotel”
Reviews.Author: magspool
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Adina and it was Wonderful. I have stayed in similar Apartment in London - but at double the price! . It's in a quiet corner of Mitte and is very well located: it’s a five-minute walk from the Hauptbanhof (main train station which has the regional and international lines) and the closest U-bahn station is a ten-minute walk. It’s a five-minute train ride to most sights in Berlin. The hotel is pretty new and quite classy with pool and gym facilities, a funky bar/restaurant and rooms with very modern interior design. Because it’s an “apartment hotel”, you get facilities that you normally wouldn’t get in a standard room – washing machine and dryer, kitchenette with all you need to make breakfast & snacks, one bedroom with television and a lounge room. We got a fantastic web rate so it was great value for money. The service was efficient and friendly - the rooms outstandingly clean and comfortable with lovely toiletries in the bathroom which included luxury body lotion. It was a pleasure to come back to the room/apartment after a days sight seeing. There is a supermarket where you can buy toiletries/breakfast essentiasl etc about a 10 minute walk, think it was an Aldi. All in all, a wonderful City with lots to see and a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SWANNY52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adina in east Berlin for three nights. What a wonderful hotel. About a 20 min walk to the Brandenburg gate and the museums, a 15 minute walk to many places to eat, and 10 min to the best Berlin wall site. The morning breakfast was outstanding with a wonderful variety. The staff was also outstanding. The only issue I would recommend is when you make a reservation and you want a suit if you have more than two people, make sure you state you want the suite. This is just different than the way we have made reservations in the States. It all worked out. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the ratings”
Reviews.Author: vandervord
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights just before Christmas and were thoroughly impressed with this hotel, in fact we simply couldn't fault it in any way. The review dated 24th December 2011 already posted sums it up very well. The apartments are immaculate and all that comprehensive equipment and furnishing looks brand new too. We didn't hear a sound from outside. Having booked an advantageous rate which included breakfast, what we can add is that this is a veritable feast with an excellent variety of top-quality delights on offer appealing to all tastes. In fact, not only one of the best hotel breakfasts we've ever enjoyed, but altogether one of the most satisfactory stays we've experienced. Very well done Adina.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Aparthotel, Central Location, Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Balix
Reviews.Content: The Adina Haptbahnhoff is an excellent base for a city break in Berlin. Whilst it is not exactly close to any of the 'headline' sites in the city, it is not too far away from most of them. It is just a five minute walk from the Hauptbahnhoff, Berlin's impressive new central station whilst five minutes in the other direction will bring you to the U-bahn and tram stops at Naturkund Museum. The immediate location is next to a major hospital and residential area and there is a fair bit of development going on so expect a bit of building noise, though the room soundproofing is very good. The hotel itself has a smallish reception area with a bar - nice, if a bit pricey - and restaurant which we didn't use. All the staff were kind and courteous. Our room was on the 6th floor though calling it a room does it a disservice. It was a one bedroom apartment with a well equipped kitchen area, comfortable living area and a separate bedroom and bathroom. The hotel is just three years old and the appartments are furnished in a modern style and have all mod cons. There are plenty of TV channels for the two TVs and you can even do your laundry if you wish with the washing machine and tumble dryer situated in the large bathroom. As our tariff did not include breakfast we simply bought some cornflakes from a nearby convinience store but there was always the alternative of using the local cafe nearby. There were three of us in our party and the hotel was ideal, with our daughter using the bed setee in the living room. There was a surcharge for this but it still meant the price was better than obtaining two rooms in a normal hotel of similar standard. There is a pool and sauna which are well worth checking out if you find you need to relax after a hard day's sightseeing. And a hard day's sightseeing is undoubtedly what you will be doing in this fascinating city. If you do come, you should definitely consider the Adina as your base.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for city exploring”
Reviews.Author: ducrmp
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly. We had a room on the 7th ( top ) floor and had good views over the city from our mini balcony. Breakfast was first class, plenty of choice and hot dishes regularly replenished by the chef and prepared for a full day of sightseeing on foot. The train staion is 10 mins walk from the hotel. Would definitely stay at the Adina again and will use this hotel group again in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Enoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: ziggyrs
Reviews.Content: Hotel room very well equipped for a small apartment. Very clean with modern decor . Centrally located near the natural history museum . One of the best hotels I stayed in . Breaksfast was buffet type good quality .Get a Berlin Welcome card . free public transport and loads of discount vouchers. Bring your bathing costume it has a heated pool. Nearest underground station is Natur Kinder Museum and 50 mins by tube from schoenefeld.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near centre of town”
Reviews.Author: Vikash1985
Reviews.Content: Like many others we stayed in this hotel based on the strength of previous reviews. the hotel was about a 35-40 min taxi from schoenefeld airport (40 euros). It's located in a quiet area about a 20 min walk from the Brandenburg gate (or 5 min tube journey). The hotel itself is great for the price. The room we had was on the 5th floor at the back of the corridor so was very quiet. The rooms are big, very clean and well furnished. The kitchenette has a microwave/oven, fridge and kettle with a few utensils so ideal for breakfast etc. The hotel itself is very nice, the restaurant is good but the menu is slightly limited but overall pretty nice. Next door to the hotel is a little Italian place that does pretty cheap pizzas, next to that is a cafe which is good for breakfast. On the right of the hotel there is a Lidl (5 min walk past the hospital which is ideal for any food/drink) No complaints at all with this hotel, would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Larry034
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Berlin for a 2-day stay, we discovered easyJet had misplaced my wife's bag, so it was after 22:00 when we got to the Adina. The reception clerk, Mr Sturm, greeted us warmly, took the information about the lost luggage and said he had upgraded us from a studio. Our 1-bedroom suite was immaculate and attractively furnished in a contemporary style. The kitchen was completely equipped as noted by other reviewers. Mr Sturm had left information about the lost luggage for the morning reception clerk, and she told us to enjoy the city and the staff would make sure the bag would be sent to our room when it arrived, and it was. The hotel location, near the Hauptbahnhof, was perfect for us as we came in on the train from the airport and left later on the train to Munich. We found it to be an easy walk of about 5 minutes, out the front entrance of the Hauptbahnhof, right on the main street in front and down the street, crossing the river.(about 600m) A word of warning: the hotel is on Platz vor dem Neuen but Google directions will send you a block too far, to Luisenstrasse. As noted, we arrived late in the evening but felt perfectly safe walking to the hotel in the dark. The location was excellent, the price was reasonable, the room was spacious and well-appointed and the staff was gracious and helpful. What more could we ask? We will definitely stay at the Adina on our next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit!”
Reviews.Author: YVOBAZ
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel to a warm welcome from the receptionist; He offered lots of maps and tips for the surrounding areas. The room was a studio apartment which meant it was spacious but had everything you needed down to a good quality iron and hairdryer. The finish on all of the furniture was really good; sleek and contemporary yet the room was comfortable. There was plenty of leaflets and information about Berlin in the room which were also helpful. The shower was powerful and huge!!! The bed was really comfy to the extent that we slept in both days. We therefore didnt eat breakfast in the hotel but the menu looked nice and was reasonably priced. There are plenty of places to eat in the surrounding areas anyway - Barista is well worth a visit - under the arches next to the hotel. The hotel location was really good; very central and next to a bustling market area with plenty of bars and restuarants; you could get a taxi outside the door no problem and the tram was right beside you. All in all would highly recommend this hotel and we will most definitely be back - excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms bigger than they look in the pictures, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: funedin
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay with my girlfriend. Very easy to find from Hauptbahnhof. Pretty much midway between mainline / underground and suburban railway stations so a 10 - 15minute walk is required if you want a train. Otherwise excellent location. Safe, clean close to numerous shops and cafes (excellent choices - the breakfast in the hotel is very expensive). Check in staff friendly and courteous, lovely smart lobby. Room absolutle highlight. Large kitchen / sitting area with dinner table. Kitchen very well kitted out. We were on the 6th floor, and balcony had views (in the distance!) of Reichstag and TV tower. Bedroom separate, again spacious and comfortable. Swimming pool relatively big, clean - noone seemed to be using it so had it to myself! Sauna large and excellent to warm up after being out in the cold. The only thing lacking is a jacuzzi - excellent spot for one next to the pool - can you not put one in?! Overall very impressive, good value for money (approx. £80 per night for double), high standard of accomodation, excellent location. And Berlin is totally awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: tyler k
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin in May of this year and stayed at the Adina near the Hauptbahnhof. Our room was really big, very clean - very nice. The staff was always helpful (and bilingual) whenever we needed. I have no complaints - though some may find it a bit out of the way, I appreciated this.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Berlin city break”
Reviews.Author: Lindamaryc
Reviews.Content: Very central location for sightseeing; public transport. Great big rooms with all facilities - we had room overlooking a small park on the 6th floor - so much light and air. We had breakfast in the many coffee shops in the area - cheaper than hotel. Spotlessly clean hotel and efficient service. Very good value for money. Recommend the 4 hour walking tour with Berlin Original Tours - great guide; superb value for money - saw all the main points of interest - fascinating. You even get the tickets for half price (only €6) if you have lunch at the restaurant where the tour starts - we did and had great food. Also recommend YMA show - 1930s style cabaret. Very spectacular - no need to speak German to enjoy. Great Italian restaurant too on Under Linden - Bocco di Bacco - recommend this for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Choose this fabulous hotel for your Berlin stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheebasyllabub
Reviews.Content: Originally booked for one night only, but decided to come back for another 2 night stay. Fabulous hotel! My friend and I shared a twin room on the 7th floor on the first night and for the remaining 2 nights were given a room on floor 2. The original bedroom had twin beds separated by a wall holding the tv with no doors to the living room. However, the 2nd floor room was better. This had a separate bedroom and had a washing machine and tumble drier in the bathroom. For us, it was worth the extra. The location is perfect. Opposite is the Natural History museum (well worth a visit), and minutes from the Underground to the right, or the Hautbahnof train station to the left. This is a fabulous place considering you're there to catch trains. Plenty of shopping and very helpful staff. Can't fault the hotel. What problems there were, were niggly ones, missing corkscrew, flat batteries in remote, having to ask for slippers for the pool and dressing gowns which were in the pool area. I would have preferred to go to the pool in the gown and slippers, but that's a minor point. The kitchen was well equipped, although I didn't like all the clutter in the fridge of the minibar stuff which was prohibitively expensive. Who makes up these prices?! Shopping can be bought from LIDL 7 minutes walk down the road (not open Sundays) but open until 8pm. There's also Kaiser's supermarket at the Hautbahnhof. Washing powder sachets can be bought from the hotel. The rooms were very warm indeed, and the quilts very heavyweight. I ended up taking the quilt out and just using the cover and a blanket,although I'm sure the staff would have given me a sheet if I'd asked. Lovely staff, nothing too much trouble. Kindly let us drop our bags in store after we checked out so we could sightsee. The seating area in the lobby is perfect to unwind before travelling, gorgeous fire and interesting books. Swimming pool and sauna are lovely. Lots of towels, dressing gowns and freebie perfume samples, and open until 11pm. Didn't eat at the hotel, but the corner coffee house does excellent soup, cakes and coffee at very reasonable prices. Will definitely come back here. Adored Berlin as a City, and this hotel sums up the spirit of the place, good value for money and wonderful people. Don't hesitate to book!

Reviews.Title: “Not child friendly and poor kitchenette”
Reviews.Author: Doofler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in October. We decided to stay here because we have a young baby and wanted a larger room and kitchenette to prepare our babies home cooked food. We were very disappointed on arrival to be told that the cot would cost us an extra €10 per night, after complaining that I was spending over €1000 at the hotel for 2 rooms they eventually waivered the fee. When asked why they charged extra for the cot they informed me it was for changing the sheets, well the sheets were not changed once during the 6 night stay - maybe they waivered this service in line with the charge! We were also disappointed to receive a room without a bath, obviously we had a baby yet this was not factored into the booking. The reception staff said that we could borrow a baby bath, but when we requested this they said someone had it and we couldn't have it until the following day, which was very disappointing. Furthermore the kitchenette is very poorly equipped. Expedia described the rooms as having full kitchenette; both our room and my parents did not have any hobs, only a combination oven/microwave. So the idea of steaming my childs food on the steamer which I bought with me went out of the window, I do 90% of my cooking at home on the hob and would describe this as an essential component of a kitchen, so again very disappointing. In summary do not book this hotel if you want a bath, a kitchenette or a room suitable for a baby. On the other hand if I stayed in the hotel just with my wife I wouldn't have had such complaints so it really depends on your circumstances. The rooms are large, modern and clean. The pool area is lovely, and the hotel also has a small gym and sauna. We didn't eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on that. In terms of location it is on a quiet street 10 minutes walk from both the Hauptbahnhof and the nearest U-bahn station. It is also about 10 minutes from Friedrichstrasse and dozens of shops, restaurants and bars. All in all the hotel is pretty decent but not outstanding, however our experience was somewhat blighted by our particular circumstances and expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment”
Reviews.Author: stevie2770
Reviews.Content: Booked in advance to get the best rates, asked for upper floor as the view is amazing over the city. We were there for three nights, everything was perfect and a welcome oasis after a long day's sightseeing. Staff were freindly and informitive, room was a spacious studio with two tellies and a well equipt kitchen/diner. Good location for main Train station and ten minute walk to shops and resturaunts, fifteen mins to Brandinberg gate etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: IchChantal
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via booking.com a few weeks in advance; a day before we were due to arrive rate had been discounted so wasn't really very happy. However, on our arrival at reception we were pleasantly surprised to be given an upgrade which was very nice indeed: a one-bed appartment instead of the studio we booked. The location is very good because of its vicinity to the central train station but we think the Adina in Haeckescher Markt is a better bet. However that one doesn't have a pool which this Adina offers.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant family hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bomboraboy
Reviews.Content: This is a good option if you are traveling with 2 kids, as you can get them into one room here. Very friendly, within a km of the reichstag, mitte and friedrichstrasse, clean and well run. Buffet breakfast is expensive but the kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: pandatrips
Reviews.Content: Ok so admittadly we did book this hotel after reading the excellent reviews, however I did not get my hopes up too much as everyone has a different opinion, however after the friendly welcome at reception, we went to our room and could easily see why this had been rated so highly, we had a studio apartment and it was honestly the largest room we have ever stayed in, immaculatly clean, comfy beds and i was pleasantly surprised to see a bath as i thought we would only get a shower! Throughout our stay the staff behind reception always greeted us with a smile and were consistently helpful, also the maid service was the best we have ever experienced-and we have stayed in many hotels-our room was kept immaculate through out our stay, All in all i would definaly go back to Berlin and I would defiantly stay in an Adina again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !good location! well appointed rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Benitta
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three who stayed at the Adina Hauptbahnof from Wednesday 26th October to Monday 31st October. We had a great time and the hotel was lovely! I had read Trip advisor reports so had an understanding of options for getting to the hotel. My recommendation after trying various was get to Hauptbahnoff station. Come out on Europlatz exit, steer right going past the modern silver statue of a horse (?) on the steps, cross the road towards the river and go right over the bridge (stay on the right hand side- just before you go over the river you will see a memorial stone to Gunter Litfin who was the first person to be shot and killed after the Berlin wall was erected in 1961). Walk along the road for a couple of hundred meters and you will find a bakery on the corner. The Adina can be found around the corner. (In the night time it will be lit up with a red sign) 10-12 minute walk. Alternatively there is a bus from Hauptbahnoff station.The 147 is only one bus stop along Invalidenstrasse. The reception staff were efficient and we were treated with good customer care (They had responded promptly and positively to previous correspondence requesting particular rooms and information regarding the hotel) We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The hotel was beautifully presented with good quality modern and welcoming furnishings. It was lovely to arrive to a seating area that was like your livingroom with a fire with flames. The rooms are additionally secured by a lift that you have to use your key card to swipe allowing access to your floor . We didnt use the reastaurant but it looked nice, the staff were friendly and it was at times very busy The hotel had a large pool which was open from 06:00 - 23:00 - my son really enjoyed using it. It had bathrobes towels and shower gel The room was well appointed with comfortable quality furnishing. The bedroom had an alarm clock and a free safe. The bed was very comfortable and clean. There was an iron/ironing board in the cupboard. A flat screen T.V on the wall. There was adequate storage and quality hangers. My son slept on the sofa settee which was comfortable. The flat screen TV in the living area has a limited range of English channels mainly news - CNN. There were films that could be accessed 10 euro for one film 18 euro for any over 24 hour . The bathroom was lovely and had shower gel and tissues. In the bathroom there is a washer and dryer. They provide washer tablets at a cost of 0.95 euro (Easy to use with directions of how to use on the inside of the door and in the hotel handbook that you will find on top of the desk.) Towels replaced on request. The kitchen has a hob and microwave (so won't cook pizzas !) There is salt and pepper, dishwashing liquid, a sponge and a tea towel. Dishwasher tablets are provided each day. More than adequate utensils, pots and cutlery . We stocked up with some basic food and drink from the Lidl around the corner. I would recommend that you take your own tea bags, coffee and sugar.The Lidl can be found about 5 min walk from Adina (At the hotel front door turn right and head through the Charity hospital interconnecting bridge. The Lidl can be found on the left hand side. It opens until 19:00. Bags are charged for.) There are quite a few eateries on this stretch of Road though we didn't try any. It feels very safe travelling around the hotel. We bought a day travel ticket from the information centre at the airport and also purchased a Berlin Welcome Card with Museum pass - last for three days (until Midnight on day three) You need to validate your transport tickets on the railway platform/ on the bus. Only need to do it once. Transport system is very good and efficient. You need to get your head around the different transport available. 'U' bahn underground, 'S' bahn are trains 'M' are trams What I enjoyed most - weather was mild and dry - perfect -Sandemans free tour (...well 10 euro each from us in tips) -Potsdam! We explored it with Sandemans tour of Potsdam(12 euro with Berlin Welcome Card) try the yummy chicken soup(about 3 euro and comes with bread/bagel) at the cafe stop off in the dutch quarter advised by the guide in Potsdam centre. Would have loved to spend another day here -Pergammon museum -Hohenschoenhausen prison/stasi museum East Berlin Gallery -Friendly people -Tip A walking tour on the first day helps you to orientate yourself Museums including the Jewish museum are closed on a Monday Get a Good map of Berlin (Sandemans tour company provide free maps at the information centre at the airport. The Map provided in the Berlin Welcome guide book is rubbish) TV Tower had huge queues and waiting times of at least an hour at night and worse in the day. Book ahead! Must book in advance for the Reichstag (my confirmation from the Reichstag took a week to arrive), remember to take your passport and allow time to get through security ... run if you see a school group hot footing it over ... they take a while) The views from the Reichstag dome are as good as the TV Tower You travel fast in the elevator in the TV Tower. Our ears popped! Berlin cathedral is closed when there are services. Check out the classical concerts that take place there Berlin Philarmonic (one of the best in World) needs to be booked well in advance The express train was delayed by 40 minutes getting back to the airport ... we just about made it. The train times returning from Hauptbahnoff were 4 and 34 minutes past the hour. Toilets in train stations are 1 euro. Some eateries (e.g. Starbucks charge 50 cents to use ... they are not very clean ) There is a toilet on some of the longer distance trains (express and the Potsdam train both had free toilets on) Protestant church at Zoological garden is being repaired and has been completely covered up. It will be available to view from mid 2012 Special exhibits at the museum island will require you to pyurchase tickets and join the queues. The Rennaisance one at the Bode was huge! People sitting for long periods of time on fold up chairs waiting. You don't need to queue at the museum if you have Berlin Welcome card - only for special exhibits

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: travelsafarohio
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the internet at a very good price, and we were glad we did. We very much enjoyed staying at the Adina Apt. Hotel. The rooms were efficiencies w. a kitchenette area and sofa w. TV and a small connected bedroom. Good bathroom w. shower. The young staff at the desk and especially in the bar and restaurant were really friendly and accommodating. Food and drinks were good and reasonably priced; however, the restaurant menu was limited in offerings. We did not buy the breakfast buffet, but there is a good inexpensive coffee shop/bakery on the corner and another place very close for coffee. The location is near the main train station. We went there to buy tours. We were also able to walk to the Wall, the Reichstag, Holocaust Museum, etc. It was farther from the shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line Stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Khristin S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top of the line. We had just come from staying in quaint properties in Poland and then, we arrived at the Adina so sparkling and shiny and modern. Seems to really fit with the character of Berlin. Everything was so clean and all details were thought of. Love having the washer and dryer--very useful when you are on a long trip. Also, it is only a few blocks walk to Hauptbahnhof where you can catch a train or metro anywhere you need to go. Although, it is also perfectly walkable to the Reichstag and Brandenburger Tor so no issues there, either. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excelllent and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Nidhi K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Adina Hotel Apartments during our Berlin trip. We booked Studio Apartment, but when we reached there, hotel people upgraded it to one bed room apartment for no cost. It was a self contained apartment, with everything in it from complete kitchenette, washing machine, dryer and cozy double bed and a Sofa. it was a wow experience, and we loved our stay there. We look forward to visit it again, whenever we get a chance to go back to Berlin. The location is very convinent and the staff is friendly too. All the main monuments are a walk away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect property in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Dunnedg
Reviews.Content: Top hotel well situated for the historic area of Berlin. 10 mins walk to main station and 5 mins from another subway. 15 minutes walk to the Reichstag Building, and Museum Island, 20 mins to Brandenburg Gate. Very friendly and helpful staff. We did not eat in the hotel but on the first day we had breakfast in the bakery/cafe on the corner. 14.95 euros for breakfast for 2. There was so much food we could not eat it all. We had a studio appt and after the first day I just popped along to the bakery in the morning and purchased rolls/pasteries and had breakfast in the room. We had a full size fridge (which we filled with beer) a microwave/grill, kettle, toaster and a full supply of crockery, cutlery etc. after a day of pounding the streets of Berlin a quick swim in the pool was an excellent way of stretching the limbs. Not a massive pool but does fine. There is an Italian accross from the hotel. We did not visit it but we were only 10/15 mins walk from Oranienburger Strasse where there is a selection of restaurants. Hard to find a 'German' restaurant however Germany is not particularily famed for its food. After returning from dinner we ended the evening with a drink in the bar which is small but cozy. The rooms are spacious and very clean and modern. The area around the hotel is quiet and we felt very safe when out walking at night. It is close to the largest hospital in Berlin the Charite. If you lose your bearings at night look out for the illuminated sign on the top of the Hospital building. Really enjoyed the stay and happy to recommend it to all sorts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: apatheia1501
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the studio apartment - great decor, comfortable and clean! All amenities included. Great restaurant staff but reception staff could improve. Closest train stations are about 15 mins by foot. Wifi is not free, which is abit of a downer seeing as most accommodation in Europe offers free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: chrism1966
Reviews.Content: This is a quality almost boutique hotel with the added value of an kitchenette. Don't be put off by other reviews about the location the hotel is a five minute walk from the hauptbahnof or the nearest S bahn. The rooms are modern and clean with the benefit of an iPod dock! The spa facilities are OK but the swimming pool is a touch on the small side but still a bonus in a city center hotel. The staff can be a little keen when re arranging the dining furniture, the breakfast had hot and cold buffet. A comfortable stay in a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: MOUNTAINMOK
Reviews.Content: For Australians travelling in Europe you will find this apartment hotel a real joy. It combines all those things you would excpect to find in your accommodation at home, (like an iron ironing board, coffe and tea making facilities) with the best of Europe. The fact that these apartments also have washing machines and dryers is an extra bonus.Its very hard when your travelling Europe to find laundromats or even hotels with washing machines. So well done Adina. The decor is smart modern, the staff are extremely helpful and all speak English well. Its an easy walk from Berlin Hauptbanhof though because of the amount of construction going on in Berlin at the moment the footpaths a bit rough.The hotel restaurant is Sydney prices but the food is good and well presented. Breakfast is also offered. There is also a fine bakery on the corner near bye and an Italian restaurant over the road if you want some variety. Having your own kitchen also is great. Internet is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable and very well located”
Reviews.Author: letyoursoulglo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Adina. It's in a quiet corner of Mitte and is very well located: it’s a five-minute walk from the Hauptbanhof (main train station which has the regional and international lines) and the closest U-bahn station is a ten-minute walk. It’s a five-minute train ride to most sights in Berlin. The hotel is new, shiny and classy – pool and gym facilities, a funky bar/restaurant and rooms with very modern interior design. Because it’s an “apartment hotel”, you get facilities that you normally wouldn’t get in a standard room – washing machine and dryer (I think that’s the upgraded rooms only), kitchenette, one bedroom with television and a lounge room. We got a fantastic web rate so it was great value for money. The service was mostly impeccable and the rooms impossibly clean and comfortable. The toiletries in the bathroom were great and the body lotion divine! The hotel guide was very helpful in giving recommendations. There were only two very small minuses for our stay. We requested a late checkout of one hour - admittedly, we only asked that morning but only because our laundry hadn't quite finished. The desk clerk at that time was quite rude about it, initially telling us no but very reluctantly letting us have a half-hour extra. Also, in the restaurant the young kid who served us forgot our order, but brought us wine to make up for it and was very apologetic. A great stay, I’d definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stp2764
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel, a place you will not at all mind coming home to after a long day of traveling around Berlin. It is an easy walk down the road to the train station and about a 15 minute walk to Berlin Cathedral, Museum Island, etc. The room had all the amenities you could want including a small washer & dryer right in the room, fridge, microwave. Comfortable bed and furniture. Extremely clean and well kept. Quiet location. Did not get the breakfast buffet, a couple small cafes are right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Vacation”
Reviews.Author: AM-EU-AU-ASIA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just great. Lots of space, very helpful staff, great restaurant and close to train station. If you do not mind walking, it is within a mile of many tourist locations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAisMyTrueHome
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. After traveling for a month, it was so nice to come to the Adina and have an apartment, with a kitchen and a full washer and dryer! (Even better, not one of those combo units that never actually dries!) The staff were very helpful and efficient. I arrived early and they had a room available for me. The room looked exactly like the pictures -- modern, clean, lovely. The bed was super comfortable. I had breakfast one day in the restaurant. I thought the buffet had a wide selection and was tasty, but a 19 Euros was a little steep. Fortunately, with the kitchen, I could easily get some bread and yoghurt myself for about 1 Euro. I wasn't sure about the location, but in the end thought it was great. Close enough to walk from the Hauptbahnhof (and I had heavy luggage), also close to the UBahn and SBahn stations -- so lots of options for transport to get to all the sites. They also rent bikes, which looked fun but I didn't have time. Just wish there was an Adina in every city I visit. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: viajeramx1
Reviews.Content: Ideal for families or long stays . It has a washing and dryer machine, kitchenette. Everything is new and clean. There is a restaurant at the lobby. Close to the main train station. No free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dori_szarvas
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews we ordered a room for two night at this hotel. being a family of 4 we found this 2 bedroom apartment excellent for us. The rooms were modern,large and shinning clean !!. the location is good and comfortable to reach all attractions via trams station (5 minutes from hotel) or subway (10 minutes away).arriving to Berlin from Prauge we found the parking lot very comfortable and reasonable priced. the cost comparing to Berlin hotels is very reasonable (about 230 euro a night for 4 people), I wouldn't recommend the hotel restaurant. hotel staff very friendly and helpful. as being expensive and not very tasty. didn't try it for breakfast.we used the car on sunday to get to part of the attractions in berlin . parking on sunday is free and no traffic problems. same in evening went to restaurants with car , no problem.

Reviews.Title: “European trip”
Reviews.Author: tommy17
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights in August halfway through a trip around Europe, what a pleasant hotel, the reception staff were excellent and check in was very efficient, we had a room looking towards the radio tower at alexander platz, as we were travelling by train this hotel was ideal only 6 minutes walk from hauptbanhof station. and about 15 mins to Unter den linden and the brandenburg gate. we love Berlin and this was our second visit to this fascinating city, if we came again I feel we would stay at the adina. if there was a downside then it would be the bathroom, the water pressure was very low and it took ages to have a proper shower.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Stay"”
Reviews.Author: fastalibali
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Adina Apartment Hotel for 3 nights. Really impressed with our room, the layout was great and enjoyed being able to make our own breakfast in the kitchen area. The staff were very friendly and helped with any queries about the area we had. The location was great for the train station and U-bhan and I believe the tram (which we never managed to catch). Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: MVB/JK
Reviews.Content: This month we stayed tor two weeks at the Adina Haubtbahnhof in Berlin. We enjoyed our stay! Rooms were well furnished and clean. Staff was professional (we especially liked the manager housekeeping and the super friendly and helpful bald headed male receptionist). The hotel is situated in a bit of a grim part of Mitte, nearby central station and U-bahn station Naturkunde Museum (the wonderful Friedrichstrasse is just two U-bahn stops away). Among the hotel facilities are a stupendous indoor swimming pool and a functional little gym. If there was a fault at the Adina, then it was the breakfast: in our opinion the buffet was too often in need of new supplies, for which we had to ask. But a stay at the Adina can certainly be recommended. It provides value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Khristophoros
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Berlin& it didn't disappoint. Booked this due to the great deal we were getting on a 3 night stay, (£100 off). We were expecting it to be a small, all in one studio but the reality was so much more. We were put into a large one bedroom apartment with all the amenities you would find in your own house, kitchenette, washing machine, tumble dryer& 2 TV's& even an iPod dock, so we were pretty over joyed by this. The rooms were maintained everyday& the style of the room was tasteful& cosy. It was very close to the Berlin Hauptbahnhof Station (Berlin Central Station), & metro, aswell as a tram stop at the opposite end of the street. There was other facilities in the Hotel including Sauna, Gym, Pool& restaurant, although we didn't find the time to use these. We really didn't want to leave at the end of our stay& would highly, highly, recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great from all persepctive”
Reviews.Author: Steph962
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights as the last stop of my honeymoon trip. This apartment hotel is definitely top-notch and the price is very reasonable. Location-wise, it is a 10-12 minutes walk to the Berlin Hauptbahnhof‎ station (there is a big supermarket there too), or a 6 minutes walk to the Naturkundemuseum‎ (Subway U6) station. There isn't too much shops nearby but we are perfectly fine with its location. The room is spacious, clean and the decoration is very modern and everything is just so cool. The kitchenette is well equipped, and we used it for making our own dinner. There is also a balcony overlooking the town (the view is so-so though). Wifi is available at a surcharge, although the receptionist said she didn't find any usage record and didn't charge us for the internet. There is a also a very small indoor pool and a sauna room where all guest can use free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Berlin Home Base”
Reviews.Author: alkastravels
Reviews.Content: The Adina Apartment Hotel Berlin Hauptbahnhof was a good base to explore Berlin. It is best for independent travelers who would like a small kitchenette to have breakfast in the room before the day's touring. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful with reservations, directions, etc. The rooms were immaculately maintained. Realize that you need to walk 10 minutes or more to get to areas with more extensive restaurant choices/shops. It is easy to walk to the central museum island, and several S and U train stops including the main station at Hauptbahnhoff. For the independent traveler who enjoys walking and is comfortable with public transportation, this is a fine place and an excellent value to enjoy Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: coillte88
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a friendly reception who gave us an upgrade. Room was spacious and very clean. On the final night we ate in the bar which was excellent. Very good value for what was available e.g. pool, suana. Good location for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: prockbirdman
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in an Adina hotel, and we will return to them once we visit Europe again! We felt as if we had rented a luxury apartment for 5 days. The restaurant downstairs was great too! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: zenovya Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is an apart-hotel. Large airy rooms (ours had a bath/shower; our companions' had only a shower but a balcony). It is in a quiet safe area and within a fifteen minute walk of the Reichstag and museums. It was clean and well run with exceptionally comfortable beds. The bar had a"happy hour" with 2 for 1 on cocktails. There are good restaurants within easy walking distance. (Der Traube/Sarah Weiner). With the substantial German food on offer, the walk was always welcome. All capital cities should have these good value hotels. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: expatsinEgypt
Reviews.Content: I know I am merely adding my voice to the chorus of praise for the Adina but I feel they deserve another 5 star rating. I am perhaps overly fussy about beds and I was very happy to find a good mattress, nice firm pillows (and soft feather ones for those who prefer them) , and good linen. I also enjoyed being able to make breakfast in my pjs while watching the BBC news and, at the end of a long day's sightseeing, having a lovely bubble bath in the very generous bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice apartment”
Reviews.Author: Carol C
Reviews.Content: Chose this from trip advisor reviews and would recommend to anyone. Really large size apartment which was really nice with two teenagers. Room was nicely furnished and beautifully clean. Very convientantly located near main station and underground. Recommend Jewish memorial and museum and City Segway Tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for our family vacation”
Reviews.Author: 123hat
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here for 5 days in mid August. My teens had a studio room and my husband and I had a 1 bedroom apt. This arrangement was perfect as we ate breakfast in my room every morning before heading out. The rooms were a perfect size for our needs and even had air-conditioning which was required during the heat wave we experienced. Everything was immaculate and the front staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location, for us, was perfect. We are big walkers and were able to walk everywhere, rarely requiring public transport (which was very conveniently located for the times we did us it). The hotel was quiet and we all agreed that the beds were very comfortable. I wasn't impressed with the surrounding restaurant choices but we always ate away from the hotel during our sightseeing so this wasn't an issue for us. Overall, a great choice for us and the best thing was the price.

Reviews.Title: “Palatial after 3 weeks of French hotels”
Reviews.Author: MisterPip
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Adina after traveling through France and staying in a series of small hotels. Arriving here was like moving into a palace. We were dazed by the new, functional appliances ("look: a fridge! a washing machine"!!) , the extra space was a luxury, and the bed was so comfortable it was only thanks to the many attractions of the city that we managed to get going in the mornings. The location initially seemed a little out of the way, but once we got used to Berlin's highly efficient transport system we found it very easy to get around, The only disappointment was that the pool was too small for dedicated lap swimmers like me.... I ended up getting my exercise pounding the Berlin pavements though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, modern, spacious but short bus ride to sites”
Reviews.Author: dgas30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Adina Hauptbahnhof for 2 nights. Bit decieving they call it 'hauptbanhof' because its a long walk from the station or a 5 mins bus ride. The nearest subway station is actually Naturkundmuseum which is on the U-Bahn, but if you are arriving into Shoenfeld get the R7 train to Friedreichstrasse and then the 147 bus to the hotel, the journey will take about 45 mins from the airport. The hotel is situated on a quite square off the main road. The hotel is modern and fresh. Our room was huge and the facilities in the room brilliant, better then you would expect for a city hotel. The room had A/C, seperate lounge area, full kitchen with fridge etc and we even had a tumble dryer and washing machine! There was a flat screen tv in the lounge and also in the bedroom. The room was so big with so many facilities you could happily stay there for a week! The hotel public areas are lovely and the hotel pool looked nice although we didn't use it, it was very popular. The breakfast buffet was really good, even had a hot selection which is unusual for a continental hotel. We didn't eat in the restaurant of an evening but the menu looked great. The only downside some people may find with the hotel is two things; 1) there isn't much in the way of restaurants/bars in walking distance. 2) Location; it is not within walking distance of any of the sites and you do need to jump on the bus or walk about 10/15mins to the nearest u-bahn. We found the buses the best thing to do as there are two stops right in front of the hotel that will pretty much take you where you need to be. You can get on one bus that takes you to the bradenburg gate in 10 mins, or to the reichstag in about the same amount of time, we enjoyed using the bus and found it more fun then the subway as you get to see more, although i can see that this would put some people off.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Adam1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adina Hauptbahnhof for a week in August in a one bedroom suite. The room was furnished nicely, was very spacious, and was comfortable. It was very quiet -- in the whole week we never once heard one of our neighbors through the walls, nor any traffic noise (since our room faced a side street). We had the breakfast in the hotel restaurant every morning and it was very good. We got lots of personal attention and terrific service from the restaurant manager Ryan Turner, and our waiter Awsam. We also had room service for dinner twice, and it was also very good. Way better than most hotel room service we've had in the past. The hotel staff overall was very friendly and helpful. The only issue we had with the hotel was housekeeping. One day we had no toilet paper (none!). One day we had no shampoo. More than once we were missing some towels. Towards the end of our stay someone from housekeeping (I think the manager) took a personal interest in us and we had great experiences from then on. For those with Internet needs, you should know that the Internet access is not free. Additionally, I was told that we could only use one device at a time (we both have iPads, so that was disappointing). We managed to work through it, but I think hotels in general are struggling to fix their business models for more connected travelers like we are. The location close to the Hauptbanhoff was great. It's about a 10 minute walk there and you're on a train to anyplace in Berlin. The neighborhood felt safe, though we were usually in before dark. The only concern we had with the neighborhood is that there are only a couple of restaurants nearby, and no grocery stores nearby (would have been nice since we had a suite with a kitchen). After a long day of walking through museums and sightseeing, we really wanted a restaurant that was close to the hotel for dinner. Overall a great experience at the Adina.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a good price?”
Reviews.Author: Maryanne42
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights at the end of our 2 month trip to Europe. Yes, it rained & we had to walk to the train station, but the exercise was good after meals of great German food! We would certainly stay there again on a trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the Family”
Reviews.Author: Wyn66
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay, really helpful staff and plenty of advice available. Roughly a 8 min walk to the main station from which to access the trains to see the sights. Use of kitchen, and washing machine was a real bonus. The pool and gym are also of good quality ( and some fantastic music in the changing area !)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: fitzymoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights with our seven year old child. The apartment was excellent, really spacious and well equipped. The pool and gym were great - we had the pool to ourselves early in the morning, but it does get crowded with families in the evening. The hotel provides towels and bathrobes in the changing area, which is very convenient. The location is good - close to the Hauptbanhoff - and handy for all the attractions in Mitte. However, there are very few restaurants in the immediate vicinity - avoid the Italian across the road in Torplatz. It's dreadful! We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: olderbutwiser657
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for one week in August, 2011. Shortly after check-in we were advised by Aaron at the front desk that there was a nominal charge for making local phone calls from the phone in our room. However upon check-out I was surprised and upset to find out that we were charged a total price of 47.9 Euros ($69) for making 2 local calls. When I questioned this charge to Andrea at the desk she advised me that the phone charges are nominal when calls are placed to local land lines, however they are quite expensive when placed to local cell phones. The manager, Sinaida, refused to discuss this matter with me but did agree to reduce the charge by 13 Euros. Small consolation. A total scam.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, quiet hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SamGorchuk
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean, quiet hotel in a good location close to the main railway station and north of the Reichstag/Brandenburg Gate. The Reichstag/Brandenburg Gate was within easy walking distance (15 minutes). The hotel had a refrigerator and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “We don't normally eat in hotels - but”
Reviews.Author: Christine B
Reviews.Content: we had a great time in Berlin on a four day city break, made even better by our stay in the Adina. A friendly greeting on arrival in excellent English. We were so surprised by the apartment, we had read all the blurb on the site, but it was better by far. The breakfast was great, catering for all tastes, again served with charm and friendliness. The main thing was that we don't eat in hotels finding them overpriced and not very good normally, but this was an exception and we had our evening meal there twice and thoroughly enjoyed both, again served with friendliness and good humour. Ryan was a hoot!!! If we are in Berlin again we shall return to Adina.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - not excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BenganJ
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have stated this is a wonderful hotel. Stayed in a two bedroom/two bathroom suite with kitchen and it was wonderful. But I don't think the location is that good. It rained a lot when we were there and it is actually quite a long walk to Berlin Hauptbahnhof (approx 1 km) so I think that name is a bit misleading. The hotel is next to the Charité hospital and there were almost not any restaurants or bars close to the hotel. The hotel bar however was really nice with a happy hour between 17.30 and 19 with cocktails for €5.50 and half price and most other items (not Champagne). Will not stay here next time, but perhaps at the two other Adinas in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further - this is the perfect hotel for a perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jensen09
Reviews.Content: I still can't believe that we found this great place so cheap and it is all worth the money! We found the location perfect as we arrived with train - only about 700 m. from Berlin Central Station. It is facing a quiet square, and Brandenburger Tor, Tiergarten and so on is within walking distance. Also, Oranienburger Strasse with great restaurants and bars is close to the hotel. Check in was easy and on top of it, we were upgraded from a studio to a 1-bedroom. A nice surprise. Room was spacious and clean. It was perfect with our own, fully equiped kitchenette where we made our own coffee and tea after a long day in town. On day we coocked our own dinner because of heavy rain, and we didn't want to go out. Lidl is right around the corner where we found basic food. We did not use the washingmascine and dryer, but I think it would be perfect for families. The room offered a couch and a flat screen TV in the livingroom and an additional tv in the bedroom. The room also had it's own iron and ironing board - really, everything you need We did not use the pool og gym, but it looked very nice. The breakfast is very good, standard german buffet. It was included in our rate, but otherwise costs 18 €, which is too much. The WIFI is not included either, but when the rooms are that cheap compared with the quality, you might be able to pay. If not, you can visit the cafe in the same boulding, which offer breakfast too. The service is wonderful, it is like a 5-star hotel. No problem was too big or too small. We visited 2 museums right next to the hotel - the museum of natural history and the museum of medical history. Both interesting and woth visiting. We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and well equipped apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grevilleana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Adina Hauptbahnhof in Berlin as we were between tours and knew we would need a washing machine. This is a prosaic but very real need on a long trip. It was marvellous after being on the road for a fortnight to settle into a large, spacious and very well equipped apartment for two nights. This would be an excellent base for a longer stay and I would in any of the Adina hotels on the basis of this good experience. The hotel was a 15 minute walk from Friedrichstrasse so some people may find it not quite central enough. However, the upside is it was quiet and one does need exercise after hearty German food.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice when travelling with kids”
Reviews.Author: santafefreak
Reviews.Content: We had adjoining rooms for our stay.We loved having the washer and dryer in our room albeit they were small and time consuming. Power does not stay on in the room unless you are in it therefore you can't put a load to dry and leave. The pool is very small and was overcrowded even after 10 p.m. but happily, it was open at that time. Check in was easy and the room was very clean and spacious. Good location and we were able to walk everywhere. Highly recommended when travelling with kids. Comfy beds and linens too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and quite perfect suite”
Reviews.Author: phvk
