Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a 1 bedroom suite. The suite was immaculate, just like the hotel was opened the day before. There was lots of space for two people and the balcony was nice extra. The location is good with short distance to U-Bahn, Hauptbahnhof is a 10 minute walk away. The room rate was very reasonable but the breakfast seemed to be a bit pricey, so we used the nice cafe at the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Obvious why this hotel is travellers choice!”
Reviews.Author: Benna1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio apartment for three days. Lovely hotel. Everything worked. Perfect for a family with children. We have nothing bad to say. Really great. This will be our favorite hotel when we drive home to Denmark from vacation in France and Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: CoalEO
Reviews.Content: First impressions were of a business hotel in a dour part of the city and I was dissapointed. But in fact we were close to some interesting spots yet still quiet at night time. So it was a good location. About halfway between NaturalHistoryMuseum on the UBahn and Haptbhanhof so very easy to get around from there. At hotel walk towards the hospital Charite and through it and there is a lidl for shopping too. Felt safe walking around at night time. Only cost €3 each to get there from Schoenfield airport (advice - ask at the tourist desk IN the airport and also buy your train ticket from there - saves struggling at the train station to understand ticket machine and wait in queue there too). Public transport excellent and €6.30 for a day pass covers Ubahn SBahn Bus and Trams for the whole city. Staff at hotel were brusque and professional, short on smiles but very efficient. Didnt get to the pool. IPhone dock in room was excellent and useful. Kitchen had everything and was very clean and tidy. Could not fault the room amenities or decor. Air conditioning, real opening windows. It was perfect. Hotel seemed to have an Australian type theme going on. The restaurant was a bit dear compared to other food on offer in Berlin but saw people eating and looked fine, it had Kangaroo Steak and Aussie burgers on the menu too. An Australian themed painted bear stands at the entrance to the hotel. Nothing extreme though. Unless breakfast is included with your rate I would avoid it as it's phenomenally over priced. €18 per person! Where to go out in Berlin: our favourite was Frederichshain, just a stop outside Ostbanhof. Enjoy Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Cool apartmemt with no fuss”
Reviews.Author: Arions
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Big room, nice bar, friendly staff. Great value for little$

Reviews.Title: “New York is king, Berlin is King Kong”
Reviews.Author: KimcoteJon
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel. Catch the train to Haptbanhof and walk to this hotel, you cross over the British Berlin wall checkpoint - although you perhaps won't realise it. So easy to get to from the airport - 3 D Bahn trains per hour and only 3 euros for a 29 minute journey. Get a Berlin ABC ticket. Station is easy to get to, 5 minute walk under covered walkway. When at Haptbanhof turn right out of station and 10 minute walk. Berlin is simply awesome, as good as if not better than New York. Adina hotel is top class - great staff and great facilities and totally clrean. You can not fault them, best hotel I've ever stayed at, deserves 5 stars rather than the 4 it's got. It's brilliantly located just inside old East Berlin, within a mile or so of all the sights. 30 minute walk to Checkpoint Charlie

Reviews.Title: “A perfect apartment stay”
Reviews.Author: sylvio007
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at this excellent apartment hotel. The rooms were spacious and lacked nothing. For us it was the chance to catch up with washing etc. The washing machine and dryer were of typical German good quality. Reception staff were helpful and made good suggestions. The restaurant and bar is well run. Ryan the bar manager ran a very professional bar and we enjoyed having an afternoon drink in the bar. Also, the plentiful supply of nibbles was appreciated as also the recommendations on wine. Have also some good Australian wines. Met the manager of Adina for Germany and can see why the staff are performing so well. Provides great leadership and knows how to manage staff with a focus on customer service. Overall, we could not have had a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “We must have had the cheap rooms”
Reviews.Author: ashlessinseattle
Reviews.Content: OK, maybe it was because we only stayed 1 night, but I booked the Adina on the strength of the great reviews on Trip Advisor and the mention of the "seating areas", "balconies", "washing machines" etc etc and what we got was a standard double room on the 7th floor (with quite a small double bed), no seating area at all (apart from the single chair) and a kitchenette. Overall the quality was OK, the staff were very helpful and the breakfast was average (by German standards) but the experience was disappointing. I guess the lesson is that if you want the Adina at it's best, make sure you ask for one of the good rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for family stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Expat088
Reviews.Content: Lovely new apartment style facilities, in a quiet pleasant setting, within walking distance of the Brandenburg Gate, Tiergartens, Bundestag etc. Modern, tasteful decor in the rooms and great use of space. Includes all the amenities helpful to a hassle-free family stay including washing machine and dryer. The restaurant was also good and there are additional cafes and bakeries on the streets below. We loved the Adina and felt it sets a new benchmark for family-sized accommodation without compromising on style and amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel good location near HBF”
Reviews.Author: ouchiwoowoo
Reviews.Content: Modern new hotel in quiet loaction near HBF but still close to the centre of the city. Staff could have been more informative- we only knew about the half price happy hour as we had read about it on trip advisor. Didn't have breakfast (overpriced I think from what I saw) but there is a great little bakery about 20metres away of the corner where we had breakfast on our way to the train station. We had the double room which is not huge but adequate and the bed in definetly a double- not a queen. Not a lot of choice nearby for restaurants- we found the Italian restaurant nearby that got rave reviews to be OK but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great find,modern,central and well equiped”
Reviews.Author: 123degrees
Reviews.Content: Best apartment we have stayed in, very new with air con in each room, small kitchen great bathroom with washer/dryer and a small balcony.Near the train line and had bike hire with plenty of good cafes nearby. Large comfy king beds, TV ipod dock etc but no wifi in room (lobby area only) which was a bit of a pain. The staff spoke good English and it had a greaqt trendy bar that was very busy on weekend. Small but well equip gym and 2 large spas and steam rooms. Location was great as we were an easy ride to al attractions but there was a train line and super market 100 feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: AndersRiedel
Reviews.Content: Adina Apartments in Berlin, is a very nice hotel just outside the city center. It's a 10-15 minute walk down Luisenstrasse before you get to anything interesting, but on the positive side you are close to the main railway station, which is enormous and you can find underground parking down to 5 Euros per day in the area. That brings me to one of my few negative comments. We stayed at Adina apartments for 2 nights and we paid 36 Euros for parking! It's actually cheaper to park in the city center than in their parking garage! 18 Euros is simply too much in this part of the city and when you on top of that pay for a room, it’s not reasonable at all. The parking booths are definitely not very big either, but we've seen worse on this trip and the price a side, we were very happy with the parking conditions. We felt the car was 100% safe in the closed basement. The reception staff is friendly, and seems very willing to help you out if you have any questions. We had a room on the top floor (room 603). A very nice and quiet room, with a view of the small square (Platz), in front of the hotel. There is a small balcony as well, where you can sit and enjoy the sun, especially in the morning. The room had a kitchenette and everything you needed except for cooking plates. There's a new microwave and plates, forks, knifes and so on. The fridge was big enough for your own shopping besides the mini bar and there is no electronic registration (hate that), so that's a big plus. The bathroom was extremely big for a European hotel and the shower was nice, but they could have made room for a bathtub. The room came with hairdryer, electric iron and a coffee machine. Quite frankly, we didn't miss anything during our stay. There is a (small) pool which will fit 2-3 people swimming at the same time , but NO Jacuzzi/hot tub, which is something you find in other Adina Hotels (There is one Copenhagen for instance). There's a sauna and a fitness room and a cozy yard with lounge chairs in connection to the pool room. We didn't try the restaurant, but it looked stylish and the food looked good. The area is not great for shopping. If you are there for shopping, you would want to go to Alexander Platz or the new trendy Kurfürstendamm shopping street and KaDeWe. Alexander Platz is about 2 kilometers away (1.2 miles or so) and Kurfürstendamm is 6-7 kilometers away (4 miles). It might seem a bit far, but you can go down there through Tiergarten, which is an oasis in Berlin and remember to stop by Berlin Zoo (you can see plenty of animals from Tiergarten without having to pay an entrance fee). Or you can just take the train. It takes less than 10 minutes by train from the Hauptbahnhof. No free Wi-Fi, not even in the lobby and that always cost a Trip Advisor star, and the location is not the best in Berlin. Everything else is in order, and so is the standard room charge. A 4 out of 5 star hotel in my book. Get free Wi-Fi and lower the parking fee with a couple of Euros and this is a clear Trip Advisor 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Perfect Hotel! Kitchenette is a real plus!”
Reviews.Author: glasgowteacher
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels i have ever had the pleasure of staying in. Very clean and tidy with very helpful staff. The pool and gym were both excellent and the kitchenette was a real bonus. Cannot speak highly enough about this place. great value stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our entire journey”
Reviews.Author: SammyFowler
Reviews.Content: We've spent most of July travelling around Europe and the Adina absolutely blew us away. It's an absolutely beautiful hotel, so well located and the price was positively excellent value. Kitchen facilities in our room was a God-send ... not to mention the amazing bathroom! Plus the king size bed wasn't bad either! The staff were lovely and very prepared to help but we also found our coming and going very easy- no one really bothered us, which for us, was a plus as well. Great accomodation, highly recommend it. They also have a pool and sauna included in the price which we didn't realise when we booked- looked great!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: saintglass
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel during a city break in July 2011 and I can say that this was probably one the best hotel experiences ever (and being 35 this was not my first ever trip). With respect to the price/quality ratio the 100 EUR per night for double room that we spend was most likely the best value for money I have ever experienced. Hotel was clean, rooms spacious and included lot of amenities (kitchen, microwave, washing mashine, dryer to name a few. Wifi was not free but the quality was good and the fees not too excessive (3,5 EUR for 180 minutes or 14,5 EUR for 14 hours which did not have to be continuing)). Staff was friendly, helpful and efficient, too bad we did not have time to check out the SPA and the saunas, next time for sure. If you come out of a hotel and your worse complaint is that maybe the water pressure in the shower maybe should have been a bit better, you know that you actually had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Ihearttravel2520
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I may of had higher expectations than this property was going to deliver. The location is not great as there are many other more vibrant and interesting areas of Berlin. The internet service was sub-par but apparently if you ask behind the desk for a secret card it works better. Wish I would have been told that upon check-in as I ended up with over 12euro in additional charges from getting knocked offline and then assuming I was getting back on within the same hour I had just paid for but it was restarting each time. The desk was less than understanding, although to be fair, other than this particular instance were very helpful in calling cabs, etc. They have bike rentals right outside the hotel which was great and the hotel is less than a mile ride to many sites. There is a pleasant enough bar, decent work-out facility (although extremely hot as is typical of being next to an indoor pool) and the room itself was quite comfortable, we had a 2 bedroom suite and it was good-sized.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with every amenity........”
Reviews.Author: SlowDance
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for 3 days at the end of June 2011 as part of a wider trip within north Germany. We found the location very suitable for viewing the city. There were underground stations nearby and the tourist bus route was near. In the immediate vicinity there were plenty of restaurants but a short walk took us to the Gendarmerie district with an even wider choice. To reach the hotel, it was an easy walk of less than 2 km from Friedrichstrasse railway station. The hotel itself had all facilities. As an apartment hotel it provided excellent accommodation with a full kitchen, a very comfortable lounge area and, in a cupboard in the en-suite bathroom, a full sized washing machine and tumble drier. We used the tumble drier to dry our swimming suits on a daily basis and, just before departure, we did a full washing which set us off on the second part of our holiday with fresh clothes. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable and minor complaints such as a broken light bulb were dealt with immediately. If we revisit Berlin we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “When we return to Berlin, we'll definitely stay at Adina!”
Reviews.Author: Lonestar438
Reviews.Content: Found Adina through trip advisor recommendations, and my husband and I were so happy with our accommodations! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Modern hotel with many amenities! Restaurant was excellent for breakfast (somewhat pricey on American standards, but fresh, healthy, filling, etc.) We had a friend from Zurich who stayed with us one night and they didn't charge us!! Very convenient location - 8 minute walk to main train station, many restaurants, sites. Adina Apartment hotels are an Australian company - a WINNER!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ErmersFamily
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Adina!! The 2 bedroom apartment with laundry facilites and full kitchen was just what we needed after a 2 week, 3 county European vacation. Apartment was clean and roomy. Staff was very helpful. Only issue was that the telephone calls took precident over face to face customer inquiries. We were asked at the desk to wait many times so telephone could be answered. Other than that, staff, location, and cleanliess was great. Be prepared to pay for wireless!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Style, Location & Comfort in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: StuartSussex
Reviews.Content: My stay was in a 2 bed apartment & it really was hard to fault it. The hotel is located in a quiet area of East Berlin, near Charité Hospital, but only 10 mins walk to Hauptbahnhof & 20 mins to Unter den Linden & Reichstag. Also 10 mins from Oranienburger Tor metro where there are shops and some more restaurants. Rooms are good size & very smartly finished with modern bathrooms & flat screen TV in bedrooms as well as lounge area. Beds were incredibly comfortable. You also get a kitchen area, though with a cafe bakery next door & restaurant in the hotel, it didn't really get much use. Only negative comments were around wifi charges (€15/day, €3.50/3h) & parking charges (€18/day, even for a short stop) which were excessive considering room rate. There is however a free Internet PC in reception with free printouts & wifi once purchased was excellent quality. This would be my first choice for a return trip. An excellent selection in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location...well worth the afforable price!”
Reviews.Author: acm03
Reviews.Content: We had 3 days (2 nights) to visit Berlin in July 2011. Adina Hauptbanhof was the perfect location to see all of Berlin. The hotel is extremely reasonable and well worth the affordable price. Our apartment (room) was ready early and they allowed us to go ahead and checkin. It rained the entire time we were there and they were more than happy to loan us umbrellas. Perfect for our family! We definitely will look to stay in Adina hotels as ofen as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: SusanSimon_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio apartment, the first stop on a 12 week overseas holiday. The hotel is excellently placed near the train station which was perfect for us. Berlin is a sensational place for walking and we easily walked everywhere we wanted to go, the Reichstad, Museum Island, Berlin Wall Memorial, Alexanderplatz, Brandenberg Gate and many places in between. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful and the restaurant has great food and prices. The room was very clean and spacious with enough of a kitchen to serve our needs. I chose The Adina through Trip Advisor reviews and , in turn, I recommend it highly to all others. Look no further and just book your stay today.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews suggest.”
Reviews.Author: willscottuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my boyfriend as a post-exam break. The location and facilities are great, being able to cook was great for managing our budget and the staff were friendly. If I had to identify a weakness of the adina it'd be the restaurant (which we went to on our first night) - pricey with narrow choice and the only unfriendly member of staff we encountered. We left and went elsewhere. Everything else was fantastic so don't let this put you off!

Reviews.Title: “Fab. Stylish trendy Berlin hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Alistairio
Reviews.Content: My wife is a Berliner and she brought me here for my birthday. Very good. Hotel looks the part and oozes Berlin cool. Location is great for shopping, restaurants and bars, plus close to the TV Tower which I managed to visit at long last. Room was nice and big with lots of extras like a cooker and fridge. Nice hotel bar too. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: ViJa38
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, very close to the station for coming in from the airport and 5 mins from the nearest S bahn/ tram stops. The staff are friendly, and really could not have been more helpful. Having extra space in the apartment with the use of the kitchen was very nice. The swimming pool is small but nice, and everywhere is clean. we wouldnt have faulted a thing here, and would definitely recommend it and return.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Ginger_Rachel
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 3 nights in early June. Checked all the various travel websites but got the best deal through the hotel itself. Paid approx 85 Euros for a studio room. Absolutely excellent value. The room was seemed HUGE with 2 TVs, small kitchenette and a balcony overlooking the East side of the city (inc TV tower). Well located about a 7-8 min walk from the Hauptbanhof. A couple of U-Bahn stations were a similar distance away in the other direction. A lot of the sights we wanted to see were in the old East Berlin so it was well located for these. Staff were very nice. We didn't opt for breakfast as it seemed quite expensive. There is a Netto about 5 mins walk away where we stocked up on breads, ham, cheese etc which of course we could store in our little kitchen. Didn't use the pool or any of the other main facilities. My only small niggle was that there was only 1 computer for public use ... which always seemed to be busy. Maybe a few more wouldn't hurt. Would definitely recommend a stay here as excellent value for money for a city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value, Huge Room and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: CanadaRambler
Reviews.Content: Really liked this place. We had the family suite and it was huge with a balcony. Bike rentals right next door. Ate in the restuarant 2 nights. The first night was great; had a wonderful male waiter and the food was excellent. The next night it was a woman waiter and the service was blah and the food not so great so who can say? Would most definitely recommend this hotel though, really helpful front desk staff, comfortable and clean. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation in every way.”
Reviews.Author: ErmerP
Reviews.Content: We booked this accommodation for location and price and the hotel didn't disappoint in any way. It was perfectly located for us, very modern, immaculate and we loved it. The staff were friendly and the barman one evening went the extra mile by making a drink he hadn't heard of, he Googled it and it was perfect, so thanks for that. We didn't use the pool but it looked very inviting. The room was spacious, comfortable and we couldn't fault it. The only downside was the price of the breakfast for 19 euros, which was quite expensive. if you walk around to Friedrichstraße 120 there are some cafes and we went to one called Chipps which had a lovely breakfast menu and it was approx. 10 euros ahead. This area is great for restaurants and shops. plus visit Bahnhof Hackescher Markt for lovely individual independent shops and bars. We loved this area. Also went to the TV Tower for an evening meal and the restaurant rotates, its very 70s in style and the food is fine but the views are absolutely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nikki90
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 5 minutes walk from the main Hauptobahnhof station which is fantastic for day trips out of Berlin to places like Potsdam etc. Beautifully presented hotel, the one bed apartment was spacious, 2 TV's, balcony, washing machine, dishwasher and well equipped kitchen perfect for making breakfasts, packed lunch and quick dinners. The lounge makes a great chill out area after a long day seeing the sights. There is also a relaxing pool area and gym and the staff were always helpful and cheery! The only thing that wasn't great was an expensive breakfast downstairs but there are all the facilities in the room so this is not a big deal!

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Stay Here and It Was Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lissa83
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at the Adina and both times have been great. We travelled with our two children and the room was nice size. They have a kitchenette which was nice if we wanted tea and to keep our drinks cold. The room was spotless and perfect for our family. We enjoyed their breakfast it had many options to satisfy our family. The restaurant and front desk staff were all friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The location is about a 10 minute walk from the main train station and it is close enough to walk to most of the attractions in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were good, service - room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: devil-m
Reviews.Content: We read the map wrongly and had wrong directions from some of the locals, hence took 1hr to find the hotel upon arrival at berlin hauptbahbhof. The hotel is a 15 mins walk from the station, was expecting it to be much closer really. The reception lady didnt offer much sympathy after we finally arrived at the hotel. But the room was great. Nice, clean, modern, and good if you want to do some simple cooking for yourself. No complaints, and would definitely recommend it. Upon checking out, the lady said we watched paid TV and took something from the mini-bar, which we didnt. What was strange was during the time she said we watched the paid TV, we were actually out. How could this have happened? I've no clue. But she did waive the charges without much debate, otherwise, this review would have turned out really different........

Reviews.Title: “good option”
Reviews.Author: conny18
Reviews.Content: I liked this apartment hotel - the rooms are really fully equipped apartments including washingmachine and dryer. It was nicely decorated, 2 tv sets ( one in lving room, one in sleeping room), comfy bed. The carpets and feather beds didnt really make it convenient for allergic people (dust allergy) but except that very clean. The breakfast buffet even offered Vegemite. Convenient location, not too busy surrounding.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel especially for groups”
Reviews.Author: JoanneDavies
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently - booking a one bed apartment, in which 3 of us comfortably stayed for the weekend. The hotel is in a great location - easy to get to everything from and in walking distance of many of them. Good facilities - really clean and modern with the added bonus of a small kitchen, so great for own breakfasts & more importantly stocking up on wine & keeping it cool in the fridge! Especially with 3 of us in the room, it made it a very cheap option in comparison to other similar quality places. All in all would thoroughly recommend

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ronvoyage
Reviews.Content: My honey and I stayed three days at the Adina Hotel near the Berlin Central train station. I made the reservation online and took advantage of the advance purchase rate. The Adina is an apartment hotel, so we had a separate bedroom with a spacious living room and kitchen. The bathroom has a large tub with a shower. Flat screen TVs were in the living room and bedroom. The kitchen was well equipped with a stove, oven/microwave, refrigerator, and dish washer. We even had a washer and dryer if you could figure out the German instructions. The Best part of our experience was the front desk staff, Andrea. She answered every question with a smile and had numerous suggestion of what to see and where the closest food store was located. I was especially impressed with her people skills and her English was excellent. Overall, the Adina is an excellent choice of an hotel in Berlin, especially because it is close to the Central train station. The service is first class and the one bedroom apartment made our stay superior. Why stay in a standard hotel when you can have a home away from home?

Reviews.Title: “Home from home in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Munrosaxman
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Adina Aparthotel near the Hauptbahnhof, Berlin, having had a good experience in its sister hotel in Copenhagen. This was probably even better. Outstandingly good value, spacious, modern and clean rooms with a good inventory of kit. It is a perfect place to stay for a few days on a city break or for longer. The communal areas are comfortable; breakfast is simple but good and was included in the price. The views were excellent from the balcony. At first sight it seems out of the city centre but in reality it is a short walk to the U-Bahn or tram and the Reichstag is no more than 20 minutes away on foot. The swimming pool is a little on the small side but really that was the only niggle. Staff are great. Will definitely go back there when I run the Berlin half marathon next year.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best...”
Reviews.Author: traveller2610
Reviews.Content: Take bus 147 to Invalidenpark (1 stop) and the hotel is just a 1 min walk, otherwise it's 5 min walk from the station. Hotel is located on a quiet square. Got a spacious room up on level 6 and had a view on the Reichstag. Breakfast is reasonable. Free WiFi at the Cafe next door. Pool and Sauna is loveley, though I didn't have much time to use it. The BIG benefit is actually the staff! They've been great. Berlin without Adina?- Not for me :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: cookstraight
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money with modern stylish furnishings and extremely helpful staff. Good tidy area in Mitte, with bakery/cafe in same block . Within 15- 20 minutes walk from Brandenburg Gate, with metro stations even closer (5 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “great place, but in a boring neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Yanayz
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice: the rooms, the service, pool & all. very quiet at night, and nothing around it is open after 8pm. If you go for sight-seeing than the location is OK, but if you want to get a more lively sense of the city, than you better find something in the "cooler" neighborhoods, like Kreuzberg or Schöneberg.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for family with children. Super comfortable flat and swimming pool opened 'til 23.00”
Reviews.Author: ensereBs
Reviews.Content: Traveled with family (wife and 1 child 11 yo) for a 3 days stay in Berlin. The Aparthotel is located at walking distance from central station and close to Reichstag and Brandburg Tor (you can walk there in about 15 min. if you like). Perfect service, cleaning and furniture. Completely equipped kitchen with oven, stovetop, microwave, dishwasher and fridge/freezer. Bathroom with washing maschine and dryer. iPhone/iPod dock for listening or recharging. Swimming pool, sauna and fitness room opened 'til 23.00. Perfect location for family who needs to cook from themself (i.e. food allergy). No wi-fi or broadband for free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Wouldn't stay here again - would like to live here :-)”
Reviews.Author: ZRH8000
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal via kuoni.ch Perfect big room, great location, excellent breakfast, a swimming pool, and very helpful and patient receptionist to locate museums and points of interest. Snags and problems? None. As I said, I wouldn't stay here again. No, I'd like to LIVE here!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: JonHarris
Reviews.Content: The Adina provided a perfect base for our five night stay in Berlin and is ideally located for some of the best bits of the city. Our apartment/suite was immaculate and well appointed and had everything we needed. All staff were super helpful and we spent a very pleasant evening in the bar and in the restaurant where we were looked after very well. Within walking distance are a great range of bars and restaurants and also the awesome Hamburger Bahnhof contemporary art gallery and Natural History Museum are minutes away. My only real complaint is that the room was a little stuffy and the air con was fairly ineffective and also no free WIFI but in some ways that was a good thing if you know what I mean. As it was so cold outside we couldnt really use the balcony to cool the room. I used the pool only once but this was very nice too. Top marks all round.

Reviews.Title: “Good surprise - very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Boizir
Reviews.Content: If visiting Berlin again, no doubt Adina Hauptbahnhof will be my choice. Roomy, good taste, great bed, TV set, and bathroom, small kitchen has everything we needed. Swimming pool, sauna, very nice lobby. In the last two nights, a movie was being shot under our window (2nd floor) and we did not listen a single noise. 10 to 15 minutes walking from Hauptbahnhof station.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: I-hate-ironing
Reviews.Content: We thought the Adina was great! Our room was like a mini-suite, although we had booked a “standard” room (whatever that means). Not sure if we got an upgrade, or if this type of room is the standard?? The room we had was split into three sections. On entering, you were in a lovely living area, with big flat screen TV, kitchenette (with dishwasher/large fridge/cooker), sofa area, work desk and small dining area. The bedroom was separate, with yet another flat screen TV. Lovely comfy bed with nice pillows and duvet. The bathroom was accessed via the living area, and was really nice. There was even a washing machine/tumble drier hidden in here! The facilities were fantastic! The décor was modern, in browns/creams with a black/white bathroom. Quality furnishings with co-ordinating cushions and footstools scattered around. Had the feel of a swanky loft apartment! We got a fantastic rate, which included breakfast (normally €19pp) via quickrooms.com. The breakfast was really good, with a buffet of hot and cold dishes, and the chef would prepare whatever kind of eggs you liked. Everything was delicious. We had very rainy weather, so ate (and drank) in the hotel every night. We had spent the whole day doing the touristy things, and had walked our legs off in the rain, so were quite happy to sit and relax in the hotels lovely surroundings. There is a happy hour between 5.30 and 7pm, and the bar staff looked after us really well. Special mention to Steven who was really smiley and made us feel really welcome. The food in the restaurant was excellent, or you could order appetisers to snack on in the bar area. We did both, and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The hotel seemed to be pretty quiet, and is set in a fairly quiet location. It is about a 15 minute stroll straight down Luisenstrasse to the Brandenburg Gate. There are frequent buses on the main street (Inavlidenstrasse). It’s one stop to Hauptbahnhof railway station, or one stop in the other direction to the underground (Zinnowitzer Strasse). It’s a 10 minute walk either way. We used the public transport frequently, jumping on/off buses/trams/underground. No problems whatsoever, as this is included in the “Berlin Welcome Ticket”. Tip1: We took an S Bahn from Schonefeld, thinking this would take us straight to Hauptbahnhof. Unfortunately, we were wrong, and had to change trains. We should have taken the Airport Express, which is an RB14 (I think), which goes through the centre of Berlin. Tip2: We arrived into Hauptbahnhof, and it was raining heavily. We had been intending to walk to the hotel, but there were lots of buses right outside the station (exit Europaplatz). As we had our train tickets, we just jumped on a bus for one stop. The hotel is round the corner from the bus stop (there is a bakery on the corner). Tip3: A lot of the Berlin Wall has been taken down, but there is still a section, and a guard tower within walking distance of the hotel. Walk towards Hauptbahnhof, there is a bridge over the river. If you cross the street, you will notice a cobbled walkway/cyclepath heading away from the city centre. Walk along cyclepath (the Institute of Technology will be on your right, and the river on your left). There is a graveyard, and the BW is in the middle of this (yes, they cut the graveyard in half)! Keep walking and you will see some modern apartments. The old watch tower is in front of these, but you need to go round the corner to see it! We had a really great time in Berlin, it really is a fascinating place. There is so much still to see and do, we will need to return when the weather is a bit better. We would have loved to have done a walking tour, but the weather was just too rainy. Also, we noticed that the walking tours seem to be at 10am during winter months. Waaaay too early for us! 12pm would have been a more suitable time, to give enough time for a leisurely breakfast, then travel to the meeting point.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Janette84
Reviews.Content: This hotel made an ideal base to explore Berlin from. It is very conveniently located for public transport and Berlin's natural history museum. We stayed in a double apartment-style room. The room was very spacious and immaculately decorated. We were very impressed. The only negative comment I have about this hotel is that breakfast is very expensive but we made our own in the kitchen within the room so this was not a problem. We also ate out during our stay so I am unable to comment on the restaurant. In conclusion we had a lovely break and felt we had got very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, top quality apartment - incredible value.”
Reviews.Author: Holidaysareace
Reviews.Content: We used this as our base to explore Berlin for four nights and couldn't believe the quality given the great value price. We had a one bedroomed apartment with sofa bed in the lounge area and it was easily large enough for a family of three. The food at breakfast and in the restaurant during the day was very good. If you'd prefer to self cater, the kitchen area was spotlessly clean and very well equipped, including washing machine and dishwasher. The pool area, whilst reasonably small, was great to relax in at the end of the day. We chose this for the location. We arrived by train and it was only a 10-15 minute walk. It is also well placed to explore the rest of the city. The staff were all very professional and extremely polite and helpful. Cannot fault it in any way. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but by no means perfect.”
Reviews.Author: TonyShields
Reviews.Content: 1 bed apartment, 4th floor. Plus points - Big & clean. Comfortable with various useful facilities such as a cooker, microwave, washing machine & ipod dock. Pool good when empty. Sauna good when working. Close to lots of restaurants & public transport. Staff very nice, upgraded at check in. Good food choice at breakfast. Cold continental breakfast food very good. Minus points - Air con poor, had to open window to sleep which made room very noisy. Pool quite narrow and can only take 2 if actually swimming. Sauna didn't work 2 days out of 4. Hot breakfast food not good, very, very greasy. No free wifi... My wife booked the hotel, I wouldn't have purely based on no free wifi. In todays world, wifi is NOT a luxury. So there you go, decent but by no means perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Super swanky place, but staff were a little weird about the broken WiFi!”
Reviews.Author: almond7777
Reviews.Content: This place is lovely. There was a slight misunderstanding about our booking: we were two families traveling together, and we wanted connecting rooms on the same floor because we were sharing a nanny/sitter for our kids. Instead they gave us rooms very far apart on different floors. However, misunderstandings happen, and they made it all ok by upgrading us to a swanky top-floor suite! The breakfast buffet is absolutely lovely and delicious with plenty of options, including American-type stuff like bagels and eggs and cereal, and more Euro-type options like yogurt and cured meats and salmon. The indoor pool is just plain awesome. The styling throughout the place is sleek and modern but still comfy, and the view of Berlin from the terrace in our top-floor room was sensational. The location is pretty darn good, walking distance to several museums and the train station, biking distance to a lot of other great stuff. (Which was handy because we never did figure out the crazy bus system). My only complaint is that during our stay the free WiFi was clearly not working, but the staff seemed unable to admit it! Instead they would tell us "Try this login and password." We'd try it, it wouldn't work, and we'd call back. "Okay, try this other login then." No dice. "What device are you using? A Mac? Try a PC. A PC? Try a Mac. Oh, it's a Dell? Try your iPhone. iPhone doesn't work? Try this other login and password and select the "Conference" option from the menu...." Later we overheard other guests at the front desk complaining about being put through the same rigamarole. And when we checked out, there was a line item for "Internet Use" on our bill. They were nice about removing it once we noticed it, though! Listen here, Adina Hotel! If the Internet is broken, just say so! We won't get mad at you! Otherwise it was a lovely place and I'm sure their WiFi is fixed by now. We were just a bit bemused by the way they chose to handle it. Perhaps it was an evolving crisis during our stay, or something they had never dealt with before.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: kulie13
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two separate short visits, once around Boxing Day and once over New Year. The first time I had a room with kitchen, and facilities were very attractive, clean and modern, with great bedding. The kitchen area provided everything you could need to cater for yourself. The second time I had a suite, which was even nicer because you could rest in a quiet separate bedroom, or you could watch two different TV channels if you wanted as both rooms had a telly. We were also on the quiet side of the hotel (facing a large courtyard) so were not disturbed by continual firecrackers on New Year's Eve - Berliners sure know how to party. The only thing not provided that I've had in more expensive hotels was a bathrobe and slippers, but everything else was of the highest standards - including the service, and the friendliness of the staff. I felt I was staying in luxury, and I love that feeling.

Reviews.Title: “great base with all the mod cons”
Reviews.Author: churmy66
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel in a quiet location just 15 minutes stroll from the Brandeburg Gate. We had a one bed appartment which was spacious and very well appointed. All in all a great spot to be based to get to all the major sights relatively easily with the U-Bahn stop 10 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation and location”
Reviews.Author: Tanya800L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment. It was perfect for myself, husband and 12 yr old son. We were even allowed to take our dog. The apartment spacious and clean. Activities and sight seeing was only a 15 min walk away. The staff were very helpful. We loved it so much, we plan to return for a longer stay in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Apartment Living with Hotel Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Lordy
Reviews.Content: Excellent apartment but with the services of a hotel at your call - such as restaurant and lovely bar downstairs! I loved this spotless, spacious, modern apartment, we had a one bed which was very comfortable and which you could easily live in! Close to Lidl (five minutes walk) where they sell excellent German chocolate for less than a euro and more importantly tea bags - our apartment had some sealed in a bag for two euros fifty - for three tea bags! Come on! Great if you are exploring, the apartments are a ten minute walk from HBF station with all it's shops and food options (definately no more than that) and close to the major restaurants and bars in Mitte. Also a nice touch after a days pounding the pavements is happy hour at the bar, lovely German beer but lots of Aussie wine aswell - all for half price, bargain! If you keep walking straight past Lidl, you'll eventually (maybe another ten minutes?) end up at the Reichstag, the Gate, an amazing Jewish memorial and the park. Doesn't get any more central than that!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern apartments”
Reviews.Author: MikePearce
Reviews.Content: Spacious modern apartments with the bonus of small pool and sauna. Breakfast with plenty of choice and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Clean, Modern, great amenities!”
Reviews.Author: RupalLondon
Reviews.Content: Prior to going to Berlin I had looked online at the hotel- through that I was impressed. When we arrived to Berlin we got the bus from the airport to the train station which they said was the nearest to our hotel.. But to be honest it was a good 20min walk with our luggage! However bus is cheaper! We arrived to the hotel, check in was simple and quick. The reception was clean, lovely decor and staff were friendly. Our room was great- felt like being at home. The beds are fantastic- had one of the best nights sleep of my life, very comfortable bed, and the duvet is great! Swimming pool is clean although I would take a pair of flip flops! You can walk to the main city center in 15-20mins. Lidl is near by near the hospital if you need to get shopping/food. Overral great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “All round understated excellent standard & Value for money”
Reviews.Author: ssunga
Reviews.Content: The Adina's strengths are :- Location - minutes from the main station and a short scenic walk into central berlin Rooms - separate bedroom, bathroom (with washing machine & dryer) and living all furnished to a ver satisfactory standard Service - Excellent service from the front desk to the bar. I will be returning to the Adina next year sometime - why ? Because I'm worth it ! My only niggle would be the restaurant was a bit lacking but there is a truly epic Italian across the road. (Not generally a fan of Italian restaurants but they won me over with the general ambiance, food, service)

Reviews.Title: “superb from start to finish....again!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireGold58
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 3rd stay at this amazing hotel, and it definitely won't be the last!!!!! The rooms are exceptionally large, with a fully equipped kichen including all mod cons, fridge/freezer & microwave to boot as well as a flat screen tv in the lounge, & a second in the bedroom. The walk in shower is fabulous & the dressing gowns & top notch toiletries are a nice touch, not forgetting the hairdryer of course! There is plenty of wardrobe space along with an ironing board & iron, as well as a safe which is included free of charge. The hotel boasts a modern gym, lovely swimming pool & sauna, again with dressing gowns, towels & toiletries provided. The bar/restaurant is welcoming & freindly & very reasonable, especially with the daily 'happy hour' that takes place. As for the hotel staff, they must be amongst the best we have ever encountered...totally professional, courteous with nothing being too much trouble for them. The breakfast buffet sets you up for the day exploring this wonderful city, with a plentiful choice of food & of great quality......the service again is second to none! We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, & are looking forward to returning again in 2011. Superb is an understatement!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!!Service in Need for improvement!”
Reviews.Author: BCafe
Reviews.Content: Good points- Great Location,Beautiful & modern rooms with all ammenities for a weekend spoil,easy access to places around,furniture contemporary and appealing,overall great infrastructure. Not so good points - Service & communication First there was a goofup by hotels.com with my reservation dates,instead of 10th they got me on 13th,called hotel 4 times before departing,sent them an email,but nobody caled back/emailed to follow up.In the end I had to change my plans,pay some fees for tickets cancellation and finally landed in Berlin on Sunday Nov14.front desk staff is courteous but they give an impression of being a unsympathetic and disconnected merchant,nickel and diming for each simple request,wifi,soap etc.YEAH NO FREE WIFI there.Anyways we had to leave monday and had to leave many clothes in the machine that was spinning for over 95mins as we were late for our next train.Informed frontdesk and told them I will contact once I get back in US for shipping.Sent an email this morning asking to give me best quote for postage-BANG!.i see $47 charged to my card by them,caled them back they said we just shipped it,I asked,Well I only asked for quote,not to ship it,She tells me its usual 'hotel policy'..Ha!..Guest having to leave their wetclothes in machine and requesting a quote to ship to US is 'usual hotel policy'????.Even after explaining this transaction is unauthorised and unapproved front desk person doesnt get the sense of responsibilty? Language barrier or inexperience..Well I let it for you all to figure!!

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: lortirma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with purpose of exploring Berlin. Located smack bang between two stations so really accessible for everything.. Even the rain didn't deter us.. Umbrella provided in foyer! Rooms were clean and modern... Even tumble dryer and washing machine provided! Rooms are controlled by thermostat for perfect temperature. Telly in living area and Bedroom. Very relaxing and quiet. Staff were very helpful and we were v impressed when the hotel gave us credit note for our friends who were unable to make it at last minute! Now that is good pr! Didn't eat in hotel so can't comment on food.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HilaryBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroomed apartment in this hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the Hauptbahnhof station, and is within walking distance of the Brandenburg Gate, the Museums and other sites. The apartment was comfortable, spacious and well furnished. Both bedrooms had double beds, one with an ensuite with a single shower. The other bathroom had a bath with shower over. The beds were comfy and we slept well. Each bedroom had a TV as did the living area. The kitchen area had a fridge, dishwasher,a two ring hob, a microwave. It also had a kettle and a toaster, and it seemed well equiped. We bought our breakfast supplies at a local supermarket. There is a Lidl just past the Charite Hospital about 5 minutes walk We had one dinner at the hotel which was lovely. The staff were polite and friendly especially in the restaurant, and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Whirlwind2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days during our recent visit to Berlin, and we found it totally agreeable in every respect, save one. The rooms are spacious and spotless; the location great for access to the Haut Bahnhof and the Berlin Metro; service was impeccable; however, I have an issue with any and all hotels that charge for Internet access, whether wired or wireless, and the Adina does charge. The group with whom they contract does not have state-of-the-art IT, and I was told several times that they have been experiencing problems with Macs--whether Iphone or laptops. This is not acceptable! They need to provide WiFi free to all guests--as many hotels are beginning to do because of the hue and cry from customers. Other than that, the place was great. Breakfast was a bit pricey (true in most European capitals), but there is a delightful coffee shop on the corner with excellent coffee and pastries. And if you go (and I HIGHLY recommend this hotel with the codicil regarding WiFi), make sure to visit the restaurant to speak to Ryan. California-bred and now a Berliner, he is a delight, as is his restaurant. He does a great weiner schnitzel.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Traveler6221
Reviews.Content: This apartment-style hotel within walking distance of Checkpoint Charlie, bits of the Berlin Wall, a central shopping/restuarant district, etc., stands fine on it own as a clean, decently priced and comfortable play to stay when visiting Berlin. Great breakfast bar and the people are generally cheerful and helpful. The swimming pool and gym are also a nice touch. What makes this place stand out, however, is the personal attention my colleagues and I received during a stay here for a conference we were throwing for our association. Their conference coordinator is outstanding, well-organized and will make what you need to happen. A special kudo must be given to General Manager Dirk Löb. In all my many travels around this world on business and leisure, I have to rate him the top hotel manager I've ever met, at least from a customer prospective. Mr. Löb personally took charge of a conference-related equipment emergency we were facing, going to extraordinary lengths to assist. He achieved results beyond all expectations. All with a calm confidence and a much-appreciated cheerfulness. For that, my colleagues and I say thank you, of course. So, if you are ever planning an event or conference in Berlin, I strongly urge you to come here first. You may find a better price or facilities elsewhere, but if you want absolute assurance that the hotel staff and management will be there for you during the event, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: apostolis76
Reviews.Content: Fully equipped kitchen, comfortable spacey rooms, nice decoration too. The hotel is only two stops from Friedrichstr. by subway, and the price is value for money 100%.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay at the Adina”
Reviews.Author: emma4646
Reviews.Content: We are 2 adults and 2 children: 7 month old baby and 3 year old child. We stayed 4 nights at the Adina near the train station in Berlin. I had booked a 2 bedroom suite but when checking in the employee offered 2 options: placing us in a 2 bedroom suite or in a studio+1 bedroom suite (interconnecting). Due to the possible noise+lighting problems with the filming of a movie near the corner of the building where the 2 bedroom suites were located,the hotel came up with an alternative. We chose to stay in the studio+1 bedroom suite. We were never bothered by any noise at night but maybe it would have been a problem had we stayed in the 2 bedroom suite... The studio and the 1 bedroom suite were very spacious,clean,and modern.The suite had a separate living room with sofa bed,a dining table with 3 chairs,and a kitchen.The studio also had a sitting area,a small dining table with 2 chairs,and kitchen but all in one big spacious room. My husband used the small yet very clean hotel pool with our 3 year old. My husband thought that the water temperature was a bit too cold for children though. We took advantage of the hotel's family package which included combi tickets for the whole family to Madame Tussaud's,Sealife+Aquadom,and Legoland.The package also included breakfast. I must mention that the hotel breakfast was quite deceiving: lack of variety,lack of freshness,etc. Compared to 2 other hotels in Germany (Sofitel in Munich and Holiday Inn in Nuremberg) where breakfast was amazing,the Adina's was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: vikkvs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Adina in Berlin during our trip to Germany in August. Hotel is very inviting, looks brand new and staff realy helpful and pleasant. We had an apartment style room with separate bedroom ( very comfortable) and living room with kitchenette extention. Room had refrigerator, minibar, washer and dryer in a bathroom ( roomy and clean), desk, free wi fi internet service, tow tv sets (in bedroom and in a living room) and many other small things. Location is very good - close to a railroad station, subway and practicly in the area close to downtown. We paid about $130.00 per night - breakfast not included, but available.

Reviews.Title: “Almost excellent.”
Reviews.Author: dinstereo
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent. Only the wireless internet fees were a bit high as was the way that you had to connect if you had an iPhone or an iPad. Other than that the rooms are huge, really huge, extremely clean and with all the amenities one would expect and then some more. The gym and the pool were also very nice and the stuff extremely helpful. All in all, I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, but beware of ala carte charges.”
Reviews.Author: Wahoo73
Reviews.Content: Four of us, two couples, stayed for four nights, Oct. 1-5. Our apartment was exactly as pictured on the web site...new, modern and very clean. Maid service and assistance at the front desk were both excellent. Our only mild complaint is that although the room rates were good, the hotel does charge a lot for parking (18E per day) and for their breakfast (18E per person). Although the breakfast buffet is quite good, it is not worth what they charge. Fortunately, there is a good coffee shop and bakery on the corner at Invalidenstrasse where you can get a very nice breakfast for 4-6 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: scottfin
Reviews.Content: 6 of us loved the adina. Great rooms, a small pool, good location, helpful staff. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Aussie Hotel run in Germany”
Reviews.Author: engam
Reviews.Content: I had a one bedroom apartment during my stay of 5 nights. It didn't take long to notice little things here and there that pointed to Australian connection. The room service menu had a dish of Kangaroo meat, and great Aussie burger. There were Aboriginal arts both in the room and corridors. The staffs were very friendly and helpful including those in the restaurant. The room was very clean, new and comfortable. I couldn't fault this hotel except that the 14,5 euro a day internet charge would stay on my mind the next time I look for a hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveller34
Reviews.Content: Really super location, 10min walk from Hauoptbanhof. It does not look like anything special from outside but inside was gorgeous. On checking in the staff in this hotel were friendly and helpful, reception looked lovely and we were not disapointed with the room. Very modern and stylish, clean, spacious and quiet despite central location. We did not eat in the hotel restuarant but did have some really reasonably priced cocktails in the bar. There is a great italian restuarant only a few metres away and other eateries within a 10 min walk. The hotel breakfast is excellent. There is also a gorgeous pool and sauna. And a courtyard where you can have a drink. We fully intend to reccommend this hotel to friends and family and should we return to Berlin will definitely book it!

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Marathon”
Reviews.Author: achinglegs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend in a twin room, having come to Berlin to run the Marathon. Well located especially for the main train station, which means it's easy to get to from Schonefeld airport via the train. Quiet location but with a few cafe's and small food outlets nearby, especially if you walk the opposite way to the main train station. Lidl supermarket nearby, ask at reception for details. Lovely spacious room, very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation, Good location”
Reviews.Author: hhilaly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is more a serviced apartment than a hotel. It has everything you could want, except for Five Star services like a concierge with connections at the best restaurants. One of the best things was the spaciousness. Living room plus bedroom meant it really was very much like a mini home-away-from home. Nice beds, nice new furnishings, lovely big bathroom, big living room. I was truly very pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sam4444
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this very nice apartment hotel. We had a studio room with kitchenette area, and separate bathroom. The kitchentte had a fridge, sink, microwave and was well equiped. The tea, coffee, beer and other in-room extras were all expensive, but there are two supermartets close by so stock up from those instead. Adina is situated short walking distance from the main central station, and about 15 mins walk to top attractions such as the parliament and Brandenburg gate. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Only downside was the expensive and very slow internet connection, otherwise very good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most comfortable rooms I have ever enjoyed in Europe”
Reviews.Author: edleo13
Reviews.Content: My wife, 15 month old son, and I spent 4 nights at the Adina Apartment Hotel Berlin Hauptbahnhof from August 18 to August 22, 2010 as part of a 10 day visit to Germany, Austria, and the Netherlands. We had a 1 bedroom suite on the 6th floor (room 610). The room had a small balcony and a nice view of both the dome on the top of the Reichstag and the Hauptbahnhof. Location: The hotel is located on Platz vor dem Neuen Tor, on the west side of the plaza, facing east. You can’t see a sign or the building itself as you are walking along Invalidenstraße (exit the Hauptbahnhof from Europlatz and go right). The hotel is a solid 10 minute walk from the station without luggage, more with (especially considering that currently some of the sidewalk is torn up on the south side of Invalidenstraße). There is a bus stop (Invalidenpark), located on Invalidenstraße within a minute or two of the hotel that is a good option is you have luggage or just don’t want to walk. There are about 5-6 bus lines that stop there (i.e. 120, 142, 147, etc. – see http://www.bvg.de/index.php/en/) which means you typically don’t have to wait very long for one to show up (we never waited more than a minute or two). Room: Having traveled in both Europe and the U.S extensively, I am very confident in describing the Adina’s rooms as extremely comfortable by both U.S. and especially European standards. Our room was comparable to the newest Staybridge Suites, Homewood Suites, Residence Inns, etc. in the U.S. It featured a small kitchen (sink, 2 burners, convection oven, dishwasher, water kettle, toaster, and small refrigerator with freezer), dining table with 3 chairs (4th was the desk chair), couch with small coffee table and ottoman, true king bed, and flat screen televisions in both the living room and bedroom. Nice touches included the washer/dryer (stick with the 3kg for 30 minutes when washing) in the bathroom and digital safe in the bedroom closet. The refrigerator was handy for storing milk and snacks for our 15 month old. Unlike extended hotels in the States, the Adina provides full housekeeping services each day (made beds, replaced towels, etc.). One final point: the air conditioner was stout, which was very nice for this American who likes it cold when he sleeps. Sightseeing: Although advertised as a Hauptbahnhof hotel, the Adina is probably more targeted to long-term guests studying/visiting/working at the Charité university hospital next door to the hotel. That said, the sights aren’t far. The closest, the Wall Documentation Center, is about a 10-15 minute walk. Everything else requires public transport, which is available at both the Hauptbahnhof or the nearby Naturkundemuseum U-Bahn stop. However, even with travel time, most sights in both the former east and west are within 15 to 25 minutes of the hotel. Food: The hotel has a small restaurant and bar that we didn’t try. There are a number of small cafes and restaurants on or very near Platz vor dem Neuen Tor, including a good little coffee/pastry shop right next to the hotel. There is a Lidl supermarket located on Luisenstraße, about 5 minutes south of the hotel. There is also a Kaiser’s supermarket in the Hauptbahnhof, however we found Kaiser’s to be extremely expensive when compared to Lidl (the Kaiser’s does have longer hours which can sometimes be helpful). Overall: We loved the Adina Hauptbanhof. The extra space and amenities were great for traveling with our 15 month old and the convenience to the Hauptbahnhof was great for both our sightseeing within Berlin and the day trip we took to Dresden. At 100 euros per night, we considered the Adina to be a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked, despite reservations well in advance.”
Reviews.Author: SKCTokyo
Reviews.Content: We had spent considerable time trying to decide where to stay in Berlin, given that it has no real center. We finally decided on the Adina near Checkpoint Charlie. When we arrived we were informed that a tour had arrived with more members than the hotel had anticipated, and that we were being relocated to the Adina near the train station. The hotel paid for a cab to take us there. It did not reimburse us for the 12 euros it cost to get to the Checkpoint Charlie Adina when we could have walked from the train station to the Hauptbahnhof Adina is less than 10 minutes. Nor did it reimburse us in any other way, unlike the airlines who make it worth your while in cases of overbooking. Welcome to Germany. The hotel itself is okay. Our treatment by the hotel was a disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: petronie
Reviews.Content: We book this hotel apartment through expedia 6 months ago, it was 40% off, what a deal! We had a one bedroom apartment, nice big comfortable bed, kitchen is good, missing a few things but workable, 2 flats screen tv, nice bathroom with a washer and dryer. Wi-fi is not free, but pretty cheap 7 euros for 12 hours (of actual time). The pool is nice, also a sauna and fitness center. 2 metro stations nearby (hauptbahnhof and Nature museum) there are about a 10 minutes walk. 2 supermarkets close to the Nature museum metro station. Good location with lots of cafe and restaurants around, about a 10 minutes walk to Reichstag and Bradenburg gate. Loved Berlin and this hotel, would definitively go back!

Reviews.Title: “The only choice”
Reviews.Author: Yummy08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is staffed by friendly, helpful staff. The rooms are fabulous, bigger than your average hotel room. Beds being comfortable for sleeping away from home in. Breakfast is great, choice of how you would like your eggs is always desirable. Location is brilliant, very close to most East Belrin major tourist sights without the noise of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Adina!”
Reviews.Author: Boris82
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Adina last month with my mum and I really couldn't speak more highly of it. We got a VERY good deal on the web so paid half what the hotel charge directly and for what we paid we were extremely impressed. Our studio was beautiful. Immaculately clean, modern, spacious with all the mod cons needed, including a large fridge (which we filled with drinks and fruit from the local supermarket). The air con in the hotel was an absoloute god-send as we were there during a heatwave weekend of 38oC and the hotel was our only respite from the sweltering heat as most restaurants and cafes in Berlin don't have air con. The pool and sauna were great - although the pool wasn't massive and was regularly full of noisy kids, but pick the right time of day and it's a great place to chill out and relax after a long day of sight-seeing. Breakfast was nice - perhaps not the hotels strongest point, but certainly nothing to grumble about. We struggled to find a table one morning as the breakfast room isn't massive and sometimes in the morning the breakfast selection looked a bit bare until the staff got around to replenishing it, but otherwise it was fine. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The location of the hotel was ideal for us: 15-20 mins stroll to the river and Freidrichstrasse station and about 10-15 mins (dragging cases) from Hauptbahnhof. We ate at the italian cafe/restaurant next door to the hotel which was nice and convenient for our first night there when we totally shattered after an early start. Food there was good - very authentic italian and cheap! We absolutely loved Berlin itself - so much to do and see. We had 4 days there and didn't even touch the surface. We could easily have spent a week there and still not have seen everything we wanted. We have got very fond memories of our visit to Berlin and stay at the Adina. It will certainly be our first choice of hotel next time we head back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent amenities!”
Reviews.Author: raincoastgirl
Reviews.Content: The Adina Apartment Hotel exceeded my expectations. At the end of a long European journey, we were ecstatic to discover a washer and dryer! The apartment was exceptionally clean and very modern. The kids loved the indoor pool which was more than adequate and there was also a small gym which was more than you would expect in a small, boutique hotel. The Hotel is in an excellent location in East Berlin, very close to the main train station and the river which has wonderful trails for running or biking. There is actually bike rental just outside the hotel. There is a small extra charge to include breakfast but it is WELL worth it. It was the best spread we had in a month compared to all the other pensions and hotels we travelled to. There were a variety of pastries, breads (including a toaster), jams, cereals, fruits, juices, yogurts, deli meats and cheeses. In fact it was so good that I noticed some patrons stashing extra food in their bags "to go" for their lunch....... The only negative would be that it not offer free WiFi but we did discover free internet access at a computer station in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, modern and convenient”
Reviews.Author: PeteDubai
Reviews.Content: Handy to the government district and just a short walk to all modes of public transport. Helpful staff and good facilities. Spacious apartment-style room.

Reviews.Title: “nice apartment hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: JackTheLadva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adina Hauptbahnhof for a weekend break. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a suite on arrival. The hotel is very clean and has a small pool and fitness suite. The location of the hotel is ideal as it is a 15 minute walk to the bars and restaurants. A bus from the airport (TXL) takes you close the hotel. Only negative was that we asked for a wake up call one morning but never received it - lucky we woke up in time to make our guided tour of Berlin. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: KasiaF4
Reviews.Content: they served a very nice breakfast, good selection of teas and German bread! clean & specious apartment! hair dryer, iron board and iron all already in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Mummylamb
Reviews.Content: We chose this place as we were travelling with a baby and wanted the freedom to eat in our room if necessary. It really was a fantastic solution, even if you don't have children. They offer everything that a good quality hotel does, except room service (which you don't need as you have your own kitchenette!) There is even a washer and dryer in the bathroom (you can buy a washing tablet for a modest sum) and a mini bottle of washing up liquid in the kitchen. We have stayed in serviced apartments before, but this place provided so much more than you can usually expect. We had a two room apartment which was very spacious and contemporary in decor. The bathroom was very nice - better quality than many 5 star hotels we have stayed in. The king size bed was very comfortable and had two separate duvets, which I understand is common in Germany. The whole place was spotless and there were two flat screen TVs. The staff were very pleasant and efficient. They didn't have any information about our request for a cot when we arrived, but by the time we got to our room someone was in there putting up the cot for us. I would highly recommend that you make time to visit the pool as it is beautiful and (that word again!) spotless. It's open from early until late and there is no limit on when children can use it ,as is often the case in larger hotels. The location was also very good- close to most attractions yet quiet enough not to be disturbed. There is a supermarket just down the road and I would suggest buying breakfast there as the in house breakfast was pricey. The tapas bar on the ground floor is great for a drink but the food wasn't really worth the money. Overall, it was excellent. and exceeded our expectations in every aspect. This place really gives the big 5 star chains a run for their money and is much better value. We have already checked out their other locations in Europe for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: squidsworth
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the adina for a short city break in Berlin and it proved to be an excellent choice of hotel. The hotel was modern and clean and nicely decorated and the rooms were spacious studio apartments with LCD tv, kitchenette, and all the amenities you could want. They were cleaned daily to a decent standard. Mini bar was available though expensive compared to what you can buy from the shop. We found a LIDL a few minutes away and here you could buy a bottle of decent red wine for less than 2 euros compared to 9 euros for half a bottle in the mini bar! The hotel had a small pool which was great after a days walking (in 37 degrees!) and was rarely occupied by anyone else. The hotel was located just opposite the natural history musuem in a fairly quiet location (10 mins walk from the main hauptbahnhof rail line) but did have a restaurant or two in the immediate vacinty. We had breakfast which was nice though not much hot food choice (the bacon was always very popular and was sometimes in short supply!!). However, coffee was issued as soon as you walked through into the breakfast area and everything else was buffet and easily obtained (cereals, meats, cheeses, bread, toaster, juices and the likes). The general hauptbahnhof location was excellent for visiting the main attractions such as the Reichstag (free entrance but get there out of peak times or expect an hour wait to get in at popular times) and check point charlie, the holocaust memorial, and tiergarden etc were all just about in walking distance though the train/underground system was easy and cheap enough to use once figured out. If there are a few of you, make use of the daily group ticket for about 16euros (upto 5 people). One useful peace of information: make sure you validate your train ticket in one of the machines in good time before your train arrives. Failure to validate might land you a hefty fine and waiting till the last minute might mean missing the train as several people would often be trying to validate the ticket as the train is about to leave! All in all I liked this hotel and Berlin very much. Probably my only gripe is the hotel charged 2.5 euros for a bag of tea, coffee, sugar and milk to use which I think they could have chucked in for free! But all in all a good hotel, especially considering we got it half price from lastminute.com! If staying in Berlin again, I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again if I could get a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jesbar11
Reviews.Content: Very close to the main train station, within walking distance -- also very close to the Naturekundesmuseum/Zinnowitzerstrasse Metro stop. Room was well decorated and very well appointed. Staff spoke English and were helpful - we arrived early and they held our bags for a few hours while we did a bit of sightseeing. The only downsides were a pricey breakfast - we skipped it and ate for less than 5 Euros at the cafe on the corner, so we really recommend going there instead - and the fact that we asked for an extra bed, which the staff told us was no problem, but it never arrived. We were lucky enough to have got a 50% off deal through a website promotion - not sure I'd have paid full price, but all in all, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and luxurious room”
Reviews.Author: pd963
Reviews.Content: We had one bed apartment-after booking studio,we must have got upgraded but no-one mentioned it. We also arrived 4 hours before check in and it was no problem.We found most of the staff were extra friendly and attentive anytime we dealt with them.They all spoke fluent english also.The room was quite big with nice sofa/dining table and chairs/full kitchen, dishwasher,cooker,pots crockery etc/writing desk and chair. Bathroom was big with plenty of toiletries (nice ones),robes and lots of towels.Also had a washer/dryer in there which we used and was really easy (1 euro if you use their own powder).Bath and shower were great also.Bedroom was good size with lots of storage and safe. Both rooms had big floor to ceiling windows (some have balcony) with blackout curtains for a good sleep. Both rooms also have good tv's-german channels though-with only cnn and bbc world news in english....they have a few movies -10 euros each for 24hours. Well stocked mini bar/kitchen replaced regularly but quite expensive as is usual. LOCATION- was great,nice quiet area within walking distance of gate,tower,park etc.Next to big train station about 5 min walk. Also 5 mins to canal with some beaches (yup-sand,deck chairs the works!) and bars there. 5 mins walk to natural history museum underground station and you can get anywhere on train for 2 euros-dead easy, even takes you to the airport for less than 3 euros! Only complaint I have is that although the room was very clean when we arrived the cleaning after that wasn't great. During a 5 day stay we only had our room cleaned 3 times and it wasn't to as high a standard as I expected.

Reviews.Title: “This is a well appointed and obviously...”
Reviews.Author: totalbroncofan
Reviews.Content: This is a well appointed and obviously new hotel. I stayed there 2 nights and was a real pleasure. I stayed in one bedroom apartment. It had a full kitchen, a dining table and living area. If I come back to Berlin I am going to stay there. Perfect for families too. Two LCD TVs and get this a washer and dryer. End review two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice- but expensive for extras”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTraveler26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a long week-end in May. We got an excellent deal on lastminutetrips.com and wouldn't have paid the regular price. It is a very nice hotel however expensive for anything extra. Breakfast was I believe around 16 euros and internet was not free. There was a small kitchenette in our room but we even needed to pay to use the soap to wash the dishes! As I said, the room was luxurious but in my mind not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: jxl36
Reviews.Content: As a family of four this was absolutely perfect for us. We had a two-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment with living area and kitchenette. The apartment was smart, new and modern with wall mounted flat screen TVs in each room, luxury toiletries, huge wardrobes and comfy beds. On the ground floor there is a smart bar and restaurant area and a leisure area with pool, gym and sauna. The hotel itself is in a good location - just across the street from the Natural History Museum and about a 10 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate and Under Den Linden. For anyone travelling in a family or group this would be the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chicago Flyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights recently. What a great find - a living room/kitchen combination and a separate bedroom. The bathroom included a washer/dryer as well. The rooms were quiet and the beds comfortable. We did not try the restaurant or bar. Easy to get to from the train station: walk out the Europlatz exit and go straight across the plaza (which is really just a drop off street) and take a right on Invalidenstrasse. Walk for a bit and take a right on to Platz vor dem Neuen Tor - you will immediately see the hotel. It is about a 10 minute walk - easy to do if you don't have a lot of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - New modern and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: bobbie_special
