Reviews.Content: My Partner and I didn't know much about this hotel before we went as it was booked as a package on Lastminute. It looked modern and luxurious on the website but we thought we'd get stuffed in a tiny room but we were wrong. Even the cheapest rooms in the hotel are spacious with huge windows, own kitchenette and bathroom. The hotel is in pristine condition and everything feels top spec. The restaurant is also good, a little more expensive than surrounding places but they have a varied menu. Breakfast is either a massive buffet or an in room service for an added charge. We tried both and couldn't fault either. The hotel is centrally located and good for transport links to any part of the city. The only downside was a constant understaffing in the restaurant and bar, where one poor waiter had to deal with everyone, it did become frustrating buyt they were always polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rewiti
Reviews.Content: Close to Main train station and to a nearby U station. In the old East Berlin which is the area you want to stay in as that is whee most of the sites are. We had a 1bedtroom apt for 3 of us which was great so I could do laundry etc. I agree that the sofabed would be bad to sleep on as an adult however it was fine for my 9 year old. Make sure you get he breakfast included in your rate. The pool and sauna were a huge bonus. The reception staff were very helpful partic as we were caught in the volcanic ash delay and had to return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & well worth a try”
Reviews.Author: Sackville
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this 'Apartment' Hotel are a good size and as the hotel is only just open, everywhere is new and in good condition. The hotel is a short walk to the Berlin Hauptbahnhof (central train station) and so not a bad location for access to the rest of the city. Breakfast (which is included in the rate but if you don't take it you get a reduction on the bill!) was good but the service was not great as there are not too many staff around this hotel. internet/WiFi is charged but they seem to have a fair usage policy so it's not too much of a rip-off. This is a good value, reasonably located mid range hotel. Well worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment Space, Hotel Service, Adina Style ...”
Reviews.Author: kinothai
Reviews.Content: ... this is what you read on the keycard, and it's exactly what you'll find at the Adina Apartment Hotel in Berlin! The room is simply amazing. Huge, clean and extremely well appointed. Good buffet breakfast. Convenient location: just a few steps from the central station. Super kind & polite staff. Extremely suggested!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moss10
Reviews.Content: Had a very enjoyable stay here at end of February 2010. Located 800 metres from the hauptbahnhof it is convenient to all of Berlin. Rooms are modern with small kitchen area and LCD tv's. Hot buffet breakfast was included in our rate and was a nice way to start the day. Only quibble was the shower seemed "designed" to leak into the bathroom, but apart from that everything was really good, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place in good location”
Reviews.Author: Nelson63
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Stylish lobby, good small pool, spacious and trendy rooms, and very friendly and helpful staff. And the breakfast was good too. A real find. Pity they charge such a lot for internet access - what is that about?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wensday
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the adina on a 3 night xmas market break after taking advantage of a start up offer (upgrade to 1 bedroom apt and breakfast included). The hotel is superbly equipped and the apartment was extremely comfortable and spacious. Conveniently located less than 10 mins walk from the hauptbahnhof station or 5 mins from Zinnowitzer Strasse. The area around the hotel is dominated by the hospital and some medical and natural history museums. There are bars and restaurants a short distance away but we didn't actually try any of them. The leisure facilities are small but perfectly formed - pool, sauna and gym with treadmills, rowing machines etc. The bar is expensive (take advantage of the happy hour) and the hotel staff across the board were very attentive and helpful. Getting to and from the hotel was easy - From Schonefeld the airport express runs direct to Hauptbahnhof (or it should do in normal times) not bad for less than 3 euros. We used the S and U bahn's on all days and travelled quite extensively around the city. A useful tip from the travel forum proved correct with single fare tickets being valid all day on advent weekends (late Nov-Dec). We visited 4 xmas markets and would recommend Gendarmenmarkt - Classy & quite upmarket, Opernpalias - Almost next door - Bigger and more relaxed - Spandau - Even bigger still and Alexanderplatz - Fairground and market - Got there at closing time so no real comment. The TV tower is well worth the queue but make sure you pick a clear day. Back to the Adina - thoroughly, thoroughly recommend it as a beautifully equipped hotel. Only faults are quite picky - 2.5 euros for a pack of tea bags & milk (in the room) - Check out the nearby Lidl just walk underneath past the hospital. Breakfast was included for us but I believe it would be 18 euros if not - I would have been dissapointed to have paid that. Also on our last night after commenting how deathly quiet (probably shouldn't use that term near a hospital) the location was, we heard a few ambulances through the night with some siren blasts but otherwise I don't think I've stayed in a quieter hotel - we never heard any other guests, lift noises, maids etc

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joust888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights very soon after the hotel opened and cannot complain about anything. Service was very good with very helpful reception and bar staff. Rooms were brand new, quiet and clean. Also large and with the small kitchen I would be very comfortable staying at this hotel for a longer period than the 2 days we spent. We did not eat at the restaurant but happy hour at the bar between 17:00 and 19:30 was well worth it. The restaurant do "Berlin style tapas" which looked lovely but we opted for the nearby restaurants and had 2 very good nights out, one of which was in the nearby street: Oranienburger Strasse which I can recommend. (Look for the less obvious 'underground' bars and restaurants) All in all a lovely stay at a very nice hotel in a great location to see all the sights in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A new hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: davcarSurrey_England
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, clean large modern room and about 10 minute walk from main station. Only negative is that they provide all tea & coffee making facilities (in a superb galley kitchen), but charge nearly 3 Euros for a pack with instant coffee sachets and lots of fruit teabags. We complained at check-out that this really was "penny-pinching" and the receptionist agreed to ignore it - good on her - but the management really ought to drop this policy as the negativity it creates for what is a really good hotel costs more than 3 Euros

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great Location. Highly reccommend”
Reviews.Author: syd1975
Reviews.Content: We arrived the day after the hotlel opened thought there might be some issues. Pleasantly surprised that didn't notice any extra noise or disruption even though they were doing some last minute snags. Staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. We went with our seven month old son and it was a bonus to have a one room apartment. The hotel is in a great location, minutes from the main train station and easy to get to all the main sights. Food was good but if not your taste there was planty of resturants nearby.Will use again when we go back.

HotelInfo.Address: Platz vor dem Neuen Tor 6, 10115 Berlin, Germany
